<div style="text-align: justify; margin-left: 0px; margin-right: 0px; text-
indent: 0px"><font style="font-size: 13px; font-family: Times New Roman">The 
aggregate market value of the registrant&#x2019;s common stock held by non-
affiliates of the registrant as of December 31, 2015 was <font style="font-
weight: bold">$339,392. </font>The stock price used in this calculation was the 
closing price of the registrant&#x2019;s stock reported on the OTCQB marketplace
on December 28, 2015, the date closest to the last business
day of the registrant&#x2019;s 2015 fiscal year.<font style="font-weight: 
bold">&#xA0;</font>For purposes of calculating this amount only, all executive 
officers and directors and beneficial owners of 5% or more of the outstanding 
shares of common stock have been treated as affiliates.</font></div>

2016 there were 49,127,825 shares of the registrant&#x2019;s common stock 
outstanding.</font></div>

<div style="text-align: justify; margin-left: 0px; margin-right: 0px; text-
indent: 0px">
<font style="font-family: Times New Roman; font-size: 13px;"><font style="color:
rgb(55, 55, 55); background-color: rgb(255, 255, 255);">The Registrant is filing
this Amendment No.&#xA0;1 on Form&#xA0;10-K/A to its Annual Report on 
Form&#xA0;10-K for the fiscal year ended December&#xA0;31, 2015 which was 
originally filed on March&#xA0;29, 2016 to correctly include the accrual of 
mineral option fees, as disclosed in the restated Financial Statements included 
herein. </font><font style="color: #000000; background-color: #FFFFFF">This
Form 10-K/A does not attempt to modify or update any other disclosures set forth
in the original Annual Report on Form 10-K, except as required to reflect the 
additional information included in the restated Financial 
Statements.</font></font></div>

<div style="text-align: left; margin-left: 0px; margin-right: 0px; text-indent: 
0px"><font style="font-weight: bold; font-size: 13px; font-family: Times New 
Roman">Cautionary Note Regarding Forward-Looking Statements.</font></div>
<div style="text-align: justify; margin-left: 0px; margin-right: 0px; text-
indent: 0px"><font style="font-size: 13px; font-family: Times New 
Roman">&#xA0;</font></div>
<div style="text-align: left; margin-left: 0px; margin-right: 0px; text-indent: 
0px"><font style="font-size: 13px; font-family: Times New Roman">This current 
report on Form 10-K (this &#x201C;Report&#x201D;) contains forward-looking 
statements. In some cases, forward-looking statements can be identified by 
terminology such as &#x201C;may&#x201D;, &#x201C;should&#x201D;, 
&#x201C;expects&#x201D;, &#x201C;plans&#x201D;, &#x201C;anticipates&#x201D;, 
&#x201C;believes&#x201D;, &#x201C;estimates&#x201D;, &#x201C;predicts&#x201D;,
&#x201C;potential&#x201D; or &#x201C;continue&#x201D; or the negative of these 
terms or other comparable terminology.&#xA0;&#xA0;These statements are only 
predictions and involve known and unknown risks and the risks set out below, any
of which may cause our actual results, levels of activity, performance or
achievements to be materially different from any future results, levels of 
activity, performance or achievements expressed or implied by these forward-
looking statements.&#xA0;&#xA0;These risks include, by way
of example and not in limitation:</font></div>
<div style="text-align: left; margin-left: 0px; margin-right: 0px; text-indent: 
0px"><font>&#xA0;</font></div>
<div style="text-align: left; display: table">
<div style="display: table-row">
<div style="text-align: left; display: table-cell; width: 24px"><font><font 
style="font-size: 13px; font-family: Times New Roman"><font style="font-family: 
Symbol, Serif">&#xB7;</font></font></font></div>
<div style="text-align: justify; display: table-cell"><font><font style="font-
size: 13px; font-family: Times New Roman">the uncertainty of future revenue and 
profitability based upon our current financial condition and history of 
losses;</font></font></div></div></div>
<div style="text-align: left; display: table">
<div style="display: table-row">
<div style="text-align: left; display: table-cell; width: 24px"><font><font 
style="font-size: 13px; font-family: Times New Roman"><font style="font-family: 
Symbol, Serif">&#xB7;</font></font></font></div>
<div style="text-align: justify; display: table-cell"><font><font style="font-
size: 13px; font-family: Times New Roman">our lack of operating 
history;</font></font></div></div></div>
<div style="text-align: left; display: table">
<div style="display: table-row">
<div style="text-align: left; display: table-cell; width: 24px"><font><font 
style="font-size: 13px; font-family: Times New Roman"><font style="font-family: 
Symbol, Serif">&#xB7;</font></font></font></div>
<div style="text-align: justify; display: table-cell"><font><font style="font-
size: 13px; font-family: Times New Roman">risks relating to our 
liquidity;</font></font></div></div></div>
<div style="text-align: left; display: table">
<div style="display: table-row">
<div style="text-align: left; display: table-cell; width: 24px"><font><font 
style="font-size: 13px; font-family: Times New Roman"><font style="font-family: 
Symbol, Serif">&#xB7;</font></font></font></div>
<div style="text-align: justify; display: table-cell"><font><font style="font-
size: 13px; font-family: Times New Roman">risks related to the market for our 
common stock and our ability to dilute our current shareholders&#x2019; 
interest;</font></font></div></div></div>
<div style="text-align: left; display: table">
<div style="display: table-row">
<div style="text-align: left; display: table-cell; width: 24px"><font><font 
style="font-size: 13px; font-family: Times New Roman"><font style="font-family: 
Symbol, Serif">&#xB7;</font></font></font></div>
<div style="text-align: justify; display: table-cell"><font><font style="font-
size: 13px; font-family: Times New Roman">risks related to our ability to locate
and proceed with a new project or business for which we can obtain 
funding;</font></font></div></div></div>
<div style="text-align: left; display: table">
<div style="display: table-row">
<div style="text-align: left; display: table-cell; width: 24px"><font><font 
style="font-size: 13px; font-family: Times New Roman"><font style="font-family: 
Symbol, Serif">&#xB7;</font></font></font></div>
<div style="text-align: justify; display: table-cell"><font><font style="font-
size: 13px; font-family: Times New Roman">risks related to our ability to obtain
adequate financing on a timely basis and on acceptable terms; 
and</font></font></div></div></div>
<div style="text-align: left; display: table">
<div style="display: table-row">
<div style="text-align: left; display: table-cell; width: 24px"><font><font 
style="font-size: 13px; font-family: Times New Roman"><font style="font-family: 
Symbol, Serif">&#xB7;</font></font></font></div>
<div style="text-align: justify; display: table-cell"><font><font style="font-
size: 13px; font-family: Times New Roman">other risks and uncertainties related 
to our business strategy.</font></font></div></div></div>
<div style="text-align: left; margin-left: 0px; margin-right: 0px; text-indent: 
0px"><font>&#xA0;</font></div>
<div style="text-align: left; margin-left: 0px; margin-right: 0px; text-indent: 
0px"><font style="font-size: 13px; font-family: Times New Roman">This list is 
not an exhaustive list of the factors that may affect any of our forward-looking
statements. These and other factors should be considered carefully and readers 
should not place undue reliance on our forward-looking statements.</font></div>
<div style="text-align: left; margin-left: 0px; margin-right: 0px; text-indent: 
0px"><font style="font-size: 13px; font-family: Times New 
Roman">&#xA0;</font></div>
<div style="text-align: left; margin-left: 0px; margin-right: 0px; text-indent: 
0px"><font style="font-size: 13px; font-family: Times New Roman">Forward looking
statements are made based on management&#x2019;s beliefs, estimates and opinions
on the date the statements are made and we undertake no obligation to update 
forward-looking statements if these beliefs, estimates and opinions or other 
circumstances should change. Although we believe that the expectations reflected
in the forward-looking statements are
reasonable, we cannot guarantee future results, levels of activity, performance 
or achievements.&#xA0;&#xA0;Except as required by applicable law, including the 
securities laws of the United States, we do not intend to update any of the 
forward-looking statements to conform these statements to actual 
results.</font></div>
<div style="text-align: left; margin-left: 0px; margin-right: 0px; text-indent: 
0px"><font>&#xA0;</font></div>
<div style="text-align: left; margin-left: 0px; margin-right: 0px; text-indent: 
0px"><font style="font-size: 13px; font-family: Times New Roman">Unless the 
context otherwise requires, references in this Report to &#x201C;LSM,&#x201D; 
the &#x201C;Company&#x201D;, &#x201C;we&#x201D;, 
&#x201C;us&#x201D;,&#xA0;&#x201C;our&#x201D;,&#xA0;or &#x201C;ours&#x201D; refer
to Lode-Star Mining Inc.</font></div>
<div style="text-align: left; margin-left: 0px; margin-right: 0px; text-indent: 
0px"><font>&#xA0;</font></div>
<div id="pgbrk" style="width: 100%; margin-left: 0px; text-indent: 0px; margin-
right: 0px">
<div id="ftr">
<div style="text-align: left; margin-left: 0px; margin-right: 0px; text-indent: 
0px; width: 100%"><font style="font-size: 13px; font-family: Times New 
Roman">&#xA0; </font></div>
<div style="text-align: center; margin-left: 0px; margin-right: 0px; text-
indent: 0px; width: 100%"><font style="font-size: 13px; font-family: Times New 
Roman">2</font></div></div>
<div id="pb" style="text-align: center; margin-left: 0px; margin-right: 0px; 
margin-bottom: 6px; page-break-after: always; width: 100%; height: 2px; 
background-color: #000000">
<!--page break-->
</div>
<div id="hdr">
<div style="text-align: right; margin-left: 0px; margin-right: 0px; text-indent:
0px; width: 100%"><font style="font-size: 13px; font-family: Times New 
Roman">&#xA0; </font></div></div></div>
<div style="text-align: left; margin-left: 0px; margin-right: 0px; text-indent: 
0px"><font>&#xA0;</font></div>
<div style="text-align: center; margin-left: auto; margin-right: auto; text-
indent: 0px"><font style="font-weight: bold; font-size: 13px; font-family: Times
New Roman">PART I.</font></div>
<div style="text-align: left; margin-left: 0px; margin-right: 0px; text-indent: 
0px"><font style="font-size: 13px; font-family: Times New 
Roman">&#xA0;</font></div>
<div style="text-align: left; margin-left: 0px; margin-right: 0px; text-indent: 
0px">
<table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="text-align: left; width: 100%; 
font-size: 13px; font-family: Times New Roman">
<tr>
<td style="width: 10%">
<div style="text-align: left; margin-left: 0px; margin-right: 0px; text-indent: 
0px"><font style="font-weight: bold; font-size: 13px; font-family: Times New 
Roman">ITEM 1.</font></div></td>
<td style="width: 90%">
<div style="text-align: left; margin-left: 0px; margin-right: 0px; text-indent: 
0px"><font style="font-weight: bold; font-size: 13px; font-family: Times New 
Roman">BUSINESS</font></div></td></tr></table></div>
<div style="text-align: left; margin-left: 0px; margin-right: 0px; text-indent: 
0px"><font style="font-size: 13px; font-family: Times New 
Roman">&#xA0;</font></div>
<div style="text-align: justify; margin-left: 0px; margin-right: 0px; text-
indent: 0px"><font style="font-size: 13px; font-family: Times New Roman">Lode-
Star Mining Inc. (formerly International Gold Corp.) was incorporated in the 
State of Nevada on December 9, 2004 for the purpose of acquiring and exploring 
mineral properties..&#xA0; Our principal executive offices are located at 13529 
Skinner Road, Suite N, Cypress, Texas 77429-1775. We also maintain a Canadian 
business office at 666 Burrard Street, Suite 600, Vancouver,
British Columbia, Canada V6E 4M8.</font></div>
<div style="text-align: justify; margin-left: 0px; margin-right: 0px; text-
indent: 0px"><font style="font-size: 13px; font-family: Times New 
Roman">&#xA0;&#xA0;</font></div>
<div style="text-align: justify; margin-left: 0px; margin-right: 0px; text-
indent: 0px"><font style="font-size: 13px; font-family: Times New Roman">On May 
12, 2015, International Gold Corp. completed a merger with its wholly owned 
subsidiary, Lode-Star Mining Inc., and formally assumed the subsidiary&#x2019;s 
name by filing Articles of Merger with the Nevada Secretary of State (the 
&#x201C;Name Change&#x201D;).&#xA0; The subsidiary was incorporated entirely for
the purpose of effecting the Name Change and the merger
did not affect our corporate structure in any other way.</font></div>
<div style="text-align: left; margin-left: 0px; margin-right: 0px; text-indent: 
0px"><font>&#xA0;</font></div>
<div style="text-align: left; margin-left: 0px; margin-right: 0px; text-indent: 
0px"><font style="font-weight: bold; font-size: 13px; font-family: Times New 
Roman">Mineral Property Interest</font></div>
<div style="text-align: left; margin-left: 0px; margin-right: 0px; text-indent: 
0px"><font>&#xA0;</font></div>
<div style="text-align: justify; margin-left: 0px; margin-right: 0px; text-
indent: 0px"><font style="font-size: 13px; font-family: Times New Roman">On 
December 5, 2014, we entered into a subscription agreement (the 
&#x201C;Subscription Agreement&#x201D;) with Lode Star Gold Inc. 
(&#x201C;LSG&#x201D;), a private Nevada corporation,&#xA0;pursuant to which we 
agreed to issue 35,000,000 shares of our common stock, valued at $230,180, to 
LSG in exchange for a 20% undivided beneficial interest in and to the mineral 
claims owned
by LSG (the &#x201C;Acquisition&#x201D;). The mineral claims, known as the 
&#x201C;Goldfield Bonanza Project&#x201D; (the &#x201C;Property&#x201D;), are 
located in the State of Nevada.</font></div>
<div style="text-align: left; margin-left: 0px; margin-right: 0px; text-indent: 
0px"><font>&#xA0;</font></div>
<div style="text-align: justify; margin-left: 0px; margin-right: 0px; text-
indent: 0px"><font style="font-size: 13px; font-family: Times New Roman">The 
execution of the Subscription Agreement was one of the closing conditions of an 
Option Agreement dated October 4, 2014,
<font style="color: #000000; font-family: Times New Roman; font-size: 13px">(the
&#x201C;Effective Date&#x201D;) </font>pursuant to which we acquired the sole 
and exclusive option to earn up to an 80% undivided interest in and to the 
Property.&#xA0;&#xA0;In order to earn the additional 60% interest in the 
Property, we are required to fund all expenditures on the Property and pay LSG 
an aggregate of $5 million in cash from the Property&#x2019;s mineral production
proceeds in the form of a net smelter
royalty (&#x201C;NSR&#x201D;). Until such time as we have earned the additional 
60% interest, the NSR will be split 79.2% to LSG, 19.8% to us and 1% to the
former Property owner.</font></div>
<div style="text-align: left; margin-left: 0px; margin-right: 0px; text-indent: 
0px"><font>&#xA0;</font></div>
<div style="text-align: justify; margin-left: 0px; margin-right: 0px; text-
indent: 0px"><font style="font-size: 13px; font-family: Times New Roman">If we 
fail to make any cash payments to LSG within one year of
<font style="color: #000000; font-family: Times New Roman; font-size: 13px">the 
Effective Date, </font>we are required to pay LSG an additional $100,000, and in
any subsequent years in which we fail to complete the payment of the entire $5 
million described above, we must make quarterly cash payments to LSG of $25,000 
until such time as we have earned the additional 60% interest in the 
Property.</font></div>
<div style="text-align: left; margin-left: 0px; margin-right: 0px; text-indent: 
0px"><font>&#xA0;</font></div>
<div style="text-align: justify; margin-left: 0px; margin-right: 0px; text-
indent: 0px"><font style="font-size: 13px; font-family: Times New Roman">The 
Option Agreement provides that we will act as the operator on the Property and 
that&#xA0;a management committee will be formed, comprised of representatives 
from us and LSG, with voting based on each party&#x2019;s proportionate 
interest, to supervise&#xA0;exploration of the Property and approve work 
programs and budgets. To the date of this report, no work programs
have been approved and LSG has borne all costs in connection with operations on 
the Property. We expect the first work program, entailing Property-related costs
for which we will be responsible, to be approved in the latter half of 
2016.</font></div>
<div style="text-align: left; margin-left: 0px; margin-right: 0px; text-indent: 
0px"><font>&#xA0;</font></div>
<div style="text-align: justify; margin-left: 0px; margin-right: 0px; text-
indent: 0px"><font style="font-size: 13px; font-family: Times New Roman">Given 
that permitting for operations on the Property is still to be completed, at the 
request of our management, LSG granted, by a letter of agreement dated November 
10, 2015, a six month deferment to June 11, 2016 of the $100,000 payment 
otherwise due within one year of the
<font style="color: #000000; font-family: Times New Roman; font-size: 
13px">Effective Date (i.e. on October 4, 2015) </font>if we fail to make any 
cash payments to LSG.</font></div>
<div style="text-align: left; margin-left: 0px; margin-right: 0px; text-indent: 
0px"><font>
<br></font></div>
<div style="text-align: justify; margin-left: 0px; margin-right: 0px; text-
indent: 0px"><font style="font-weight: bold; font-size: 13px; font-family: Times
New Roman">Change in Officers</font></div>
<div style="text-align: left; margin-left: 0px; margin-right: 0px; text-indent: 
0px"><font>&#xA0;</font></div>
<div style="text-align: justify; margin-left: 0px; margin-right: 0px; text-
indent: 0px"><font style="font-size: 13px; font-family: Times New Roman">As a 
result of the Acquisition and on the Closing Date, our former President and 
Chief Executive officer submitted his resignation and Mark Walmesley, our Chief 
Financial Officer, Treasurer and a director, as well as a director of LSG, was 
appointed to fill the resulting vacancies.&#xA0;&#xA0;Mr. Walmesley is now our 
President, Chief Executive Officer, Chief Financial
Officer, Treasurer and a director.</font></div>
<div style="text-align: left; margin-left: 0px; margin-right: 0px; text-indent: 
0px"><font>&#xA0;</font></div>
<div style="text-align: justify; margin-left: 0px; margin-right: 0px; text-
indent: 0px"><font style="font-weight: bold; font-size: 13px; font-family: Times
New Roman">Change in Shell Company Status</font></div>
<div style="text-align: left; margin-left: 0px; margin-right: 0px; text-indent: 
0px"><font>&#xA0;</font></div>
<div style="text-align: justify; margin-left: 0px; margin-right: 0px; text-
indent: 0px"><font style="font-size: 13px; font-family: Times New Roman">Prior 
to our acquisition of the mineral property interest, we were a &#x201C;<font 
style="background-color: #ffffff">shell company&#x201D; (</font>as such term is 
defined in Rule 12b-2 under the Exchange Act)<font style="background-color:
#ffffff">&#xA0;since we were not generating revenues, did not own an operating 
business, did not have any assets other than cash and cash
equivalents, and had no specific plan other than to engage in a merger or 
acquisition transaction with an operating </font></font><font style="font-size: 
13px; font-family: Times New Roman"><font style="background-color: 
#ffffff">company or business. </font>We have no revenues, have losses since 
inception, have no direct operations, and have been issued a going concern 
opinion by our auditor. We are relying upon the sale of securities and loans to 
fund our operations. We have no employees and expect to use outside
consultants, advisors, attorneys and accountants as necessary.</font></div>
<div style="text-align: left; margin-left: 0px; margin-right: 0px; text-indent: 
0px"><font>&#xA0;</font></div>
<div style="text-align: left; margin-left: 0px; margin-right: 0px; text-indent: 
0px"><font>&#xA0;</font></div>
<div id="pgbrk" style="width: 100%; margin-left: 0px; text-indent: 0px; margin-
right: 0px">
<div id="ftr">
<div style="text-align: left; margin-left: 0px; margin-right: 0px; text-indent: 
0px; width: 100%"><font style="font-size: 13px; font-family: Times New 
Roman">&#xA0; </font></div>
<div style="text-align: center; margin-left: 0px; margin-right: 0px; text-
indent: 0px; width: 100%"><font style="font-size: 13px; font-family: Times New 
Roman">3</font></div></div>
<div id="pb" style="text-align: center; margin-left: 0px; margin-right: 0px; 
margin-bottom: 6px; page-break-after: always; width: 100%; height: 2px; 
background-color: #000000">
<!--page break-->
</div>
<div id="hdr">
<div style="text-align: right; margin-left: 0px; margin-right: 0px; text-indent:
0px; width: 100%"><font style="font-size: 13px; font-family: Times New 
Roman">&#xA0; </font></div></div></div>
<div style="text-align: left; margin-left: 0px; margin-right: 0px; text-indent: 
0px"><font>&#xA0;</font></div>
<div style="text-align: left; margin-left: 0px; margin-right: 0px; text-indent: 
0px">
<table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="text-align: left; width: 100%; 
font-size: 13px; font-family: Times New Roman">
<tr>
<td style="width: 10%">
<div style="text-align: left; margin-left: 0px; margin-right: 0px; text-indent: 
0px"><font style="font-weight: bold; font-size: 13px; font-family: Times New 
Roman">ITEM 1.</font></div></td>
<td style="width: 90%">
<div style="text-align: left; margin-left: 0px; margin-right: 0px; text-indent: 
0px"><font style="font-size: 13px; font-family: Times New Roman"><font 
style="font-weight: bold">BUSINESS </font>(<font style="font-style: 
italic">continued</font>)</font></div></td></tr></table></div>
<div style="text-align: left; margin-left: 0px; margin-right: 0px; text-indent: 
0px"><font>&#xA0;</font></div>
<div style="text-align: justify; margin-left: 0px; margin-right: 0px; text-
indent: 0px"><font style="font-weight: bold; font-size: 13px; font-family: Times
New Roman">Change in Control of Registrant</font></div>
<div style="text-align: left; margin-left: 0px; margin-right: 0px; text-indent: 
0px"><font>&#xA0;</font></div>
<div style="text-align: justify; margin-left: 0px; margin-right: 0px; text-
indent: 0px"><font style="font-size: 13px; font-family: Times New Roman">As a 
result of the Acquisition, LSG acquired 35,000,000 shares of our common stock, 
or approximately 71.2% (currently) of the total voting power of all of our 
outstanding voting securities.&#xA0;&#xA0;LSG assumed control from the holders 
of our issued and outstanding common stock, and in particular our former 
president, who owned approximately 24.3% of our common stock
prior to the Closing Date.</font></div>
<div style="text-align: left; margin-left: 0px; margin-right: 0px; text-indent:
0px"><font>&#xA0;</font></div>
<div style="text-align: justify; margin-left: 0px; margin-right: 0px; text-
indent: 0px"><font style="font-weight: bold; font-size: 13px; font-family: Times
New Roman">Lode-Star Gold Inc. (&#x201C;LSG&#x201D;)</font></div>
<div style="text-align: left; margin-left: 0px; margin-right: 0px; text-indent: 
0px"><font>&#xA0;</font></div>
<div style="text-align: justify; margin-left: 0px; margin-right: 0px; text-
indent: 0px"><font style="font-size: 13px; font-family: Times New Roman">LSG was
incorporated in the State of Nevada on March 13, 1998 for the purpose of 
acquiring exploration stage mineral properties.&#xA0;&#xA0;It currently has one 
shareholder, Lonnie Humphries, who is the spouse of Mark Walmesley, our 
President and Chief Financial Officer.&#xA0;&#xA0;Mr. Walmesley is also the 
Director of Operations and a director of LSG.</font></div>
<div style="text-align: left; margin-left: 0px; margin-right: 0px; text-indent: 
0px"><font>&#xA0;</font></div>
<div style="text-align: justify; margin-left: 0px; margin-right: 0px; text-
indent: 0px"><font style="font-size: 13px; font-family: Times New Roman">LSG 
acquired the leases to the Property in 1997 and became the registered and 
beneficial owner of the Property on September 19, 2009.&#xA0;&#xA0;Since the 
earlier of those dates, it has conducted contract exploration work on the 
Property but has not determined whether it contains mineral reserves that are 
economically recoverable.</font></div>
<div style="text-align: left; margin-left: 0px; margin-right: 0px; text-indent: 
0px"><font>&#xA0;</font></div>
<div style="text-align: justify; margin-left: 0px; margin-right: 0px; text-
indent: 0px"><font style="font-size: 13px; font-family: Times New Roman">LSG is 
an exploration stage company and has not generated any revenues since its 
inception.&#xA0;&#xA0;The Property represents its only material 
asset.</font></div>
<div style="text-align: left; margin-left: 0px; margin-right: 0px; text-indent: 
0px"><font>
<br></font></div>
<div style="text-align: left; margin-left: 0px; margin-right: 0px; text-indent: 
0px">
<table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="text-align: left; width: 100%; 
font-size: 13px; font-family: Times New Roman">
<tr>
<td style="width: 10%">
<div style="text-align: left; margin-left: 0px; margin-right: 0px; text-indent: 
0px"><font style="font-weight: bold; font-size: 13px; font-family: Times New 
Roman">ITEM 1A.</font></div></td>
<td style="width: 90%">
<div style="text-align: left; margin-left: 0px; margin-right: 0px; text-indent: 
0px"><font style="font-weight: bold; font-size: 13px; font-family: Times New 
Roman">RISK FACTORS.</font></div></td></tr></table></div>
<div style="text-align: left; margin-left: 0px; margin-right: 0px; text-indent: 
0px"><font>&#xA0;</font></div>
<div style="text-align: justify; margin-left: 0px; margin-right: 0px; text-
indent: 0px"><font style="font-size: 13px; font-family: Times New Roman">You 
should carefully consider the risks described below before purchasing our common
stock. The following risk factors could have a material adverse effect on our 
business, financial condition and results of operations.</font></div>
<div style="text-align: left; margin-left: 0px; margin-right: 0px; text-indent: 
0px"><font>&#xA0;</font></div>
<div style="text-align: justify; margin-left: 0px; margin-right: 0px; text-
indent: 0px"><font style="font-weight: bold; font-style: italic; font-size: 
13px; font-family: Times New Roman">We have a history of operating losses and 
there can be no assurance that we can achieve or maintain 
profitability.</font></div>
<div style="text-align: left; margin-left: 0px; margin-right: 0px; text-indent: 
0px"><font>&#xA0;</font></div>
<div style="text-align: justify; margin-left: 0px; margin-right: 0px; text-
indent: 0px"><font style="font-size: 13px; font-family: Times New Roman">We have
a history of operating losses and may not achieve or sustain
profitability.&#xA0;&#xA0;We cannot guarantee that we will become 
profitable.&#xA0;&#xA0;Even if we achieve profitability, given the competitive 
and evolving nature of the industry in which we operate, we may be unable to 
sustain or increase profitability and our failure to do so would adversely 
affect
our business, including our ability to raise additional funds.</font></div>
<div style="text-align: left; margin-left: 0px; margin-right: 0px; text-indent: 
0px"><font>&#xA0;</font></div>
<div style="text-align: justify; margin-left: 0px; margin-right: 0px; text-
indent: 0px"><font style="font-weight: bold; font-style: italic; font-size: 
13px; font-family: Times New Roman">Because our auditors have issued a going 
concern opinion, there is substantial uncertainty that we will be able to 
continue our operations.</font></div>
<div style="text-align: left; margin-left: 0px; margin-right: 0px; text-indent: 
0px"><font>&#xA0;</font></div>
<div style="text-align: justify; margin-left: 0px; margin-right: 0px; text-
indent: 0px"><font style="font-size: 13px; font-family: Times New Roman">Our 
auditors have issued a going concern opinion.&#xA0;&#xA0;This means that there 
is substantial doubt that we can continue to operate over the next 12 
months.&#xA0;&#xA0;Our financial statements do not include any 
adjustments&#xA0;relating to the recoverability and classification of recorded 
assets, or the amounts of and classification of liabilities that might be 
necessary
in the event we cannot continue in existence.&#xA0;As such, if we are unable to 
obtain new financing to execute our business plan we may be required to cease 
our operations.</font></div>
<div style="text-align: left; margin-left: 0px; margin-right: 0px; text-indent: 
0px"><font>&#xA0;</font></div>
<div style="text-align: justify; margin-left: 0px; margin-right: 0px; text-
indent: 0px"><font style="font-weight: bold; font-style: italic; font-size: 
13px; font-family: Times New Roman">The Property may not contain mineral 
reserves that are economically recoverable and we cannot accurately predict the 
effect of certain factors affecting such a determination.</font></div>
<div style="text-align: left; margin-left: 0px; margin-right: 0px; text-indent: 
0px"><font>&#xA0;</font></div>
<div style="text-align: justify; margin-left: 0px; margin-right: 0px; text-
indent: 0px"><font style="font-size: 13px; font-family: Times New Roman">LSG has
not determined if the Property contains mineral reserves that are economically 
recoverable.&#xA0;&#xA0;Exploration for mineral reserves involves a high degree 
of risk, which even a combination of careful evaluation, experience and 
knowledge, may not eliminate.&#xA0;&#xA0;Few properties which are explored are 
ultimately developed into producing properties.&#xA0;&#xA0;Regardless,
LSG is currently in the process of re-opening&#xA0;its underground working and 
plans to complete the first and second phases of its feasibility program, which,
pursuant to the Option Agreement, we are required to fund.</font></div>
<div style="text-align: left; margin-left: 0px; margin-right: 0px; text-indent: 
0px"><font>&#xA0;</font></div>
<div style="text-align: left; margin-left: 0px; margin-right: 0px; text-indent: 
0px"><font>&#xA0;</font></div>
<div style="text-align: left; margin-left: 0px; margin-right: 0px; text-indent: 
0px"><font>&#xA0;</font></div>
<div style="text-align: left; margin-left: 0px; margin-right: 0px; text-indent: 
0px"><font>&#xA0;</font></div>
<div style="text-align: left; margin-left: 0px; margin-right: 0px; text-indent: 
0px"><font>&#xA0;</font></div>
<div style="text-align: left; margin-left: 0px; margin-right: 0px; text-indent: 
0px"><font>&#xA0;</font></div>
<div style="text-align: left; margin-left: 0px; margin-right: 0px; text-indent: 
0px"><font>&#xA0;</font></div>
<div style="text-align: left; margin-left: 0px; margin-right: 0px; text-indent: 
0px"><font>&#xA0;</font></div>
<div style="text-align: left; margin-left: 0px; margin-right: 0px; text-indent: 
0px"><font>&#xA0;</font></div>
<div id="pgbrk" style="width: 100%; margin-left: 0px; text-indent: 0px; margin-
right: 0px">
<div id="ftr">
<div style="text-align: left; margin-left: 0px; margin-right: 0px; text-indent: 
0px; width: 100%"><font style="font-size: 13px; font-family: Times New 
Roman">&#xA0; </font></div>
<div style="text-align: center; margin-left: 0px; margin-right: 0px; text-
indent: 0px; width: 100%"><font style="font-size: 13px; font-family: Times New 
Roman">4</font></div></div>
<div id="pb" style="text-align: center; margin-left: 0px; margin-right: 0px; 
margin-bottom: 6px; page-break-after: always; width: 100%; height: 2px; 
background-color: #000000">
<!--page break-->
</div>
<div id="hdr">
<div style="text-align: right; margin-left: 0px; margin-right: 0px; text-indent:
0px; width: 100%"><font style="font-size: 13px; font-family: Times New 
Roman">&#xA0; </font></div></div></div>
<div style="text-align: left; margin-left: 0px; margin-right: 0px; text-indent: 
0px"><font>
<br></font></div>
<div style="text-align: left; margin-left: 0px; margin-right: 0px; text-indent: 
0px">
<table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="text-align: left; width: 100%; 
font-size: 13px; font-family: Times New Roman">
<tr>
<td style="width: 10%">
<div style="text-align: left; margin-left: 0px; margin-right: 0px; text-indent: 
0px"><font style="font-weight: bold; font-size: 13px; font-family: Times New 
Roman">ITEM 1A.</font></div></td>
<td style="width: 90%">
<div style="text-align: left; margin-left: 0px; margin-right: 0px; text-indent: 
0px"><font style="font-size: 13px; font-family: Times New Roman"><font 
style="font-weight: bold">RISK FACTORS </font><font style="font-style: 
italic">(continued)</font></font></div></td></tr></table></div>
<div style="text-align: left; margin-left: 0px; margin-right: 0px; text-indent: 
0px"><font>&#xA0;</font></div>
<div style="text-align: justify; margin-left: 0px; margin-right: 0px; text-
indent: 0px"><font style="font-size: 13px; font-family: Times New 
Roman">Estimates of mineral reserves and any potential determination as to 
whether a mineral deposit will be commercially viable can be affected by such 
factors as deposit size; grade; unusual or unexpected geological formations and 
metallurgy; proximity to infrastructure; metal prices which are highly cyclical;
environmental factors; unforeseen technical difficulties; work interruptions;
and government regulations, including regulations relating to permitting, 
prices, taxes, royalties, land tenure, land use, importing and exporting of 
minerals and environmental protection.&#xA0;&#xA0;The exact effect of these 
factors cannot be accurately predicted.</font></div>
<div style="text-align: justify; margin-left: 0px; margin-right: 0px; text-
indent: 0px"><font style="font-size: 13px; font-family: Times New 
Roman">&#xA0;</font></div>
<div style="text-align: justify; margin-left: 0px; margin-right: 0px; text-
indent: 0px"><font style="font-size: 13px; font-family: Times New Roman">The 
long term profitability of our operations will be, in part, directly related to 
the cost and success of our exploration and development 
program.&#xA0;&#xA0;Substantial expenditures are required to establish reserves 
through drilling, to develop processes to extract the ore and, in the case of 
new properties, to develop the extraction and processing facilities and 
infrastructure
at any site chosen for extraction.&#xA0;&#xA0;Although substantial benefits may 
be derived from the discovery of a major deposit, we cannot provide any 
assurance that any such deposit will be commercially viable or that we will be 
able to obtain the funds required for development on a timely 
basis.</font></div>
<div style="text-align: left; margin-left: 0px; margin-right: 0px; text-indent:
0px"><font>&#xA0;</font></div>
<div style="text-align: justify; margin-left: 0px; margin-right: 0px; text-
indent: 0px"><font style="font-weight: bold; font-style: italic; font-size: 
13px; font-family: Times New Roman">If the Property is ultimately placed into 
production, we will encounter hazards and risks that could result in significant
legal liability.</font></div>
<div style="text-align: left; margin-left: 0px; margin-right: 0px; text-indent: 
0px"><font>&#xA0;</font></div>
<div style="text-align: justify; margin-left: 0px; margin-right: 0px; text-
indent: 0px"><font style="font-size: 13px; font-family: Times New Roman">In the 
event that we are ultimately able to commence commercial production on the 
Property, our operations will be subject to all of the hazards and risks 
normally encountered in the exploration, development and production of gold, 
including unusual and unexpected geologic formations, seismic activity, rock 
bursts, cave-ins, flooding and other conditions involved in the
drilling and removal of material, any of which could result in damage to, or 
destruction of, the mine and other producing facilities, damage to life or 
property, environmental damage and possible legal liability.&#xA0;&#xA0;Although
we plan to take appropriate precautions to mitigate these hazards and risks by, 
among other things, obtaining liability insurance in an amount considered to be 
adequate by management, their nature is such that the liabilities might exceed 
policy limits, they might not be insurable,
or we may not elect to insure against them due to high premium costs or other 
reasons, which could have a material adverse effect upon our financial condition
and results of operations.</font></div>
<div style="text-align: left; margin-left: 0px; margin-right: 0px; text-indent: 
0px"><font>&#xA0;</font></div>
<div style="text-align: justify; margin-left: 0px; margin-right: 0px; text-
indent: 0px"><font style="font-weight: bold; font-style: italic; font-size: 
13px; font-family: Times New Roman">We face significant competition in the 
mineral resource industry that presents an ongoing threat to the success of our 
business.</font></div>
<div style="text-align: left; margin-left: 0px; margin-right: 0px; text-indent: 
0px"><font>&#xA0;</font></div>
<div style="text-align: justify; margin-left: 0px; margin-right: 0px; text-
indent: 0px"><font style="font-size: 13px; font-family: Times New Roman">The 
mining industry is intensely competitive in all of its phases, and we will be 
forced to compete with many companies that possess greater financial resources 
and technical facilities than we do.&#xA0;&#xA0;Significant competition exists 
for the limited number of mineral acquisition opportunities available in our 
sphere of operations.&#xA0;&#xA0;As a result of this competition,
our ability to acquire additional attractive mining properties on terms we 
consider acceptable may be adversely affected.</font></div>
<div style="text-align: left; margin-left: 0px; margin-right: 0px; text-indent: 
0px"><font>&#xA0;</font></div>
<div style="text-align: justify; margin-left: 0px; margin-right: 0px; text-
indent: 0px"><font style="font-weight: bold; font-style: italic; font-size: 
13px; font-family: Times New Roman">Fluctuating mineral prices may negatively 
affect our ability to secure financing or our results of 
operations.</font></div>
<div style="text-align: left; margin-left: 0px; margin-right: 0px; text-indent: 
0px"><font>&#xA0;</font></div>
<div style="text-align: justify; margin-left: 0px; margin-right: 0px; text-
indent: 0px"><font style="font-size: 13px; font-family: Times New Roman">Our 
future revenues, if any, will likely be derived from the extraction and sale of 
base and precious metals.&#xA0;&#xA0;The price of those commodities has 
fluctuated widely, particularly in recent years, and is affected by numerous 
factors beyond our control including economic and political trends, expectations
of inflation, currency exchange fluctuations, interest rates,
global and regional consumptive patterns, speculative activities and increased 
production due to new extraction developments and improved extraction and 
production methods.&#xA0;&#xA0;The effect of these factors on the price of base 
and precious metals, and therefore the economic viability of our business, could
negatively affect our ability to secure financing or our results of
operations.</font></div>
<div style="text-align: left; margin-left: 0px; margin-right: 0px; text-indent: 
0px"><font>&#xA0;</font></div>
<div style="text-align: justify; margin-left: 0px; margin-right: 0px; text-
indent: 0px"><font style="font-weight: bold; font-style: italic; font-size: 
13px; font-family: Times New Roman">We are subject to government laws and 
regulations particular to our operations with which we may be unable to 
comply.</font></div>
<div style="text-align: justify; margin-left: 0px; margin-right: 0px; text-
indent: 0px"><font style="font-size: 13px; font-family: Times New 
Roman">&#xA0;</font></div>
<div style="text-align: justify; margin-left: 0px; margin-right: 0px; text-
indent: 0px"><font style="font-size: 13px; font-family: Times New Roman">We may 
not be able to comply with all current and future government environmental laws 
and regulations which are applicable to our business. &#xA0;Our operations are 
subject to all government regulations normally incident to conducting business: 
occupational safety and health acts, workmen&#x2019;s compensation statutes, 
unemployment insurance legislation, income tax and
social security laws and regulations, and most importantly, environmental laws 
and regulations.&#xA0;&#xA0;In addition, we are subject to laws and regulations 
regarding the development of mineral properties in the State of 
Nevada.&#xA0;&#xA0;We are also subject to governmental laws and regulations 
applicable to small public companies and their capital formation 
efforts.</font></div>
<div style="text-align: justify; margin-left: 0px; margin-right: 0px; text-
indent: 0px"><font style="font-size: 13px; font-family: Times New 
Roman">&#xA0;</font></div>
<div style="text-align: justify; margin-left: 0px; margin-right: 0px; text-
indent: 0px"><font style="font-size: 13px; font-family: Times New Roman">We are 
engaged in mineral exploration and are accordingly exposed to environmental 
risks associated with mineral exploration and mining activity. &#xA0;LSG is 
currently in the exploration stage and has not determined whether significant 
site reclamation costs will be required on the Property in the future, which we 
will likely be responsible for as well.&#xA0;&#xA0;Although
we will make every effort to comply with all applicable laws and regulations, we
cannot provide any assurance that we will be able to deal with evolving 
environmental attitudes and regulations, nor can we predict the effect of any 
future changes to environmental regulations on our proposed business 
activities.&#xA0;&#xA0;We only plan to record liabilities for site reclamation 
when reasonably determinable and when such costs can be reliably 
quantified.&#xA0;&#xA0;Other costs of compliance with environmental regulations
may also be burdensome.&#xA0;</font></div>
<div style="text-align: left; margin-left: 0px; margin-right: 0px; text-indent: 
0px"><font>&#xA0;</font></div>
<div id="pgbrk" style="width: 100%; margin-left: 0px; text-indent: 0px; margin-
right: 0px">
<div id="ftr">
<div style="text-align: left; margin-left: 0px; margin-right: 0px; text-indent: 
0px; width: 100%"><font style="font-size: 13px; font-family: Times New 
Roman">&#xA0; </font></div>
<div style="text-align: center; margin-left: 0px; margin-right: 0px; text-
indent: 0px; width: 100%"><font style="font-size: 13px; font-family: Times New 
Roman">5</font></div></div>
<div id="pb" style="text-align: center; margin-left: 0px; margin-right: 0px; 
margin-bottom: 6px; page-break-after: always; width: 100%; height: 2px; 
background-color: #000000">
<!--page break-->
</div>
<div id="hdr">
<div style="text-align: right; margin-left: 0px; margin-right: 0px; text-indent:
0px; width: 100%"><font style="font-size: 13px; font-family: Times New 
Roman">&#xA0; </font></div></div></div>
<div style="text-align: left; margin-left: 0px; margin-right: 0px; text-indent: 
0px"><font>&#xA0;</font></div>
<div style="text-align: left; margin-left: 0px; margin-right: 0px; text-indent: 
0px">
<table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="text-align: left; width: 100%; 
font-size: 13px; font-family: Times New Roman">
<tr>
<td style="width: 10%">
<div style="text-align: left; margin-left: 0px; margin-right: 0px; text-indent: 
0px"><font style="font-weight: bold; font-size: 13px; font-family: Times New 
Roman">ITEM 1A.</font></div></td>
<td style="width: 90%">
<div style="text-align: left; margin-left: 0px; margin-right: 0px; text-indent: 
0px"><font style="font-size: 13px; font-family: Times New Roman"><font 
style="font-weight: bold">RISK FACTORS (</font><font style="font-style: 
italic">continued)</font></font></div></td></tr></table></div>
<div style="text-align: left; margin-left: 0px; margin-right: 0px; text-indent: 
0px"><font>&#xA0;</font></div>
<div style="text-align: justify; margin-left: 0px; margin-right: 0px; text-
indent: 0px"><font style="font-size: 13px; font-family: Times New Roman">Our 
failure to comply with material regulatory requirements could have an adverse 
effect on our ability to conduct our business.&#xA0;&#xA0;The expenditure of 
substantial sums on environmental matters would have a materially negative 
effect on our ability to implement our business plan and could require us to 
cease operations.</font></div>
<div style="text-align: left; margin-left: 0px; margin-right: 0px; text-indent: 
0px"><font style="font-weight: bold; font-style: italic; font-size: 13px; font-
family: Times New Roman">&#xA0;</font></div>
<div style="text-align: left; margin-left: 0px; margin-right: 0px; text-indent: 
0px"><font style="font-weight: bold; font-style: italic; font-size: 13px; font-
family: Times New Roman">Our business depends substantially on the continuing 
efforts of our officers, and our business may be severely disrupted if we lose 
their services.</font></div>
<div style="text-align: left; margin-left: 0px; margin-right: 0px; text-indent: 
0px"><font>&#xA0;</font></div>
<div style="text-align: justify; margin-left: 0px; margin-right: 0px; text-
indent: 0px"><font style="font-size: 13px; font-family: Times New Roman">Our 
future success heavily depends on the continued service of our 
officers.&#xA0;&#xA0;Although we plan to increase the size of our Board of 
Directors, appoint additional officers and engage various consultants as our 
business grows, if they are unable or unwilling to continue to work for us in 
their present capacities, we may have to spend a considerable amount of time
and resources searching, recruiting and integrating one or more replacements 
into our operations, which would severely disrupt our business.&#xA0;&#xA0;This 
may also adversely affect our ability to execute our business 
strategy.</font></div>
<div style="text-align: left; margin-left: 0px; margin-right: 0px; text-indent: 
0px"><font>&#xA0;</font></div>
<div style="text-align: justify; margin-left: 0px; margin-right: 0px; text-
indent: 0px"><font style="font-weight: bold; font-style: italic; font-size: 
13px; font-family: Times New Roman">Our new President&#x2019;s limited 
experience managing a publicly traded company may divert his attention from 
operations and harm our business.</font></div>
<div style="text-align: left; margin-left: 0px; margin-right: 0px; text-indent: 
0px"><font>&#xA0;</font></div>
<div style="text-align: justify; margin-left: 0px; margin-right: 0px; text-
indent: 0px"><font style="font-size: 13px; font-family: Times New Roman">Mark 
Walmesley, our President, Chief Executive Officer, Chief Financial Officer, 
Treasurer and director, has no previous experience managing a publicly traded 
company and complying with federal securities laws, including compliance with 
recently adopted disclosure requirements on a timely basis.&#xA0;&#xA0;He will 
be required to design and implement appropriate programs
and policies in responding to increased legal, regulatory compliance and 
reporting requirements, and any failure to do so could lead to the imposition of
fines and penalties and harm our business.</font></div>
<div style="text-align: left; margin-left: 0px; margin-right: 0px; text-indent:
0px"><font>&#xA0;</font></div>
<div style="text-align: justify; margin-left: 0px; margin-right: 0px; text-
indent: 0px"><font style="font-weight: bold; font-style: italic; font-size: 
13px; font-family: Times New Roman">We may be unable to attract and retain 
qualified, experienced, highly skilled personnel, which could adversely affect 
the implementation of our business plan.</font></div>
<div style="text-align: left; margin-left: 0px; margin-right: 0px; text-indent: 
0px"><font>&#xA0;</font></div>
<div style="text-align: justify; margin-left: 0px; margin-right: 0px; text-
indent: 0px"><font style="font-size: 13px; font-family: Times New Roman">Our 
success depends to a significant degree upon our ability to attract, retain and 
motivate skilled and qualified personnel.&#xA0;&#xA0;As we become a more mature 
company in the future, we may find recruiting and retention efforts more 
challenging.&#xA0;&#xA0;If we do not succeed in attracting, hiring and 
integrating such personnel, or retaining and motivating existing
personnel, we may be unable to grow effectively.&#xA0;&#xA0;The loss&#xA0;of any
key employee, including members of our management team, and our inability to 
attract highly skilled personnel with sufficient experience in our industry 
could harm our business.</font></div>
<div style="text-align: left; margin-left: 0px; margin-right: 0px; text-indent: 
0px"><font style="font-size: 13px; font-family: Times New 
Roman">&#xA0;&#xA0;</font></div>
<div style="text-align: justify; margin-left: 0px; margin-right: 0px; text-
indent: 0px"><font style="font-weight: bold; font-style: italic; font-size: 
13px; font-family: Times New Roman">We may indemnify our officers and directors 
against liability to us and our security holders, and such indemnification could
increase our operating costs.</font></div>
<div style="text-align: left; margin-left: 0px; margin-right: 0px; text-indent: 
0px"><font>&#xA0;</font></div>
<div style="text-align: justify; margin-left: 0px; margin-right: 0px; text-
indent: 0px"><font style="font-size: 13px; font-family: Times New Roman">Our 
Amended and Restated Articles of Incorporation allow us to indemnify our 
officers and directors against claims associated with carrying out the duties of
their offices.&#xA0;&#xA0;Our Bylaws also allow us to reimburse them for the 
costs of certain legal defenses.&#xA0;&#xA0;Insofar as indemnification for 
liabilities arising under the Securities Act may be permitted
to our officers, directors or control persons, we have been advised by the SEC 
that such indemnification is against public policy and is therefore 
unenforceable.</font></div>
<div style="text-align: left; margin-left: 0px; margin-right: 0px; text-indent: 
0px"><font>&#xA0;</font></div>
<div style="text-align: justify; margin-left: 0px; margin-right: 0px; text-
indent: 0px"><font style="font-size: 13px; font-family: Times New Roman">Since 
our officers and directors are aware that they may be indemnified for carrying 
out the duties of their offices, they may be less motivated to meet the 
standards required by law to properly carry out such duties, which could 
increase our operating costs.&#xA0;&#xA0;Further, if any of our officers and 
directors files a claim against us for indemnification, the associated
expenses could also increase our operating costs.</font></div>
<div style="text-align: left; margin-left: 0px; margin-right: 0px; text-indent: 
0px"><font>&#xA0;</font></div>
<div style="text-align: justify; margin-left: 0px; margin-right: 0px; text-
indent: 0px"><font style="font-weight: bold; font-size: 13px; font-family: Times
New Roman"><font style="font-style: italic">Failure to comply with 
the&#xA0;</font>Foreign Corrupt Practices Act<font style="font-style: 
italic">&#xA0;could subject us to penalties and other adverse 
consequences.</font></font></div>
<div style="text-align: left; margin-left: 0px; margin-right: 0px; text-indent: 
0px"><font>&#xA0;</font></div>
<div style="text-align: justify; margin-left: 0px; margin-right: 0px; text-
indent: 0px"><font style="font-size: 13px; font-family: Times New Roman">As a 
Nevada corporation, we are subject to the&#xA0;<font style="font-style: 
italic">Foreign Corrupt Practices Act</font>, which generally prohibits United 
States companies from engaging in bribery or other prohibited payments to
foreign officials for the purpose of obtaining or retaining 
business.&#xA0;&#xA0;Some foreign companies, including some that may compete 
with
us, may not be subject to these prohibitions.&#xA0;&#xA0;Corruption, extortion, 
bribery, pay-offs, theft and other fraudulent practices may occur from time-to-
time in the countries in which we conduct our business.&#xA0;&#xA0;However, our 
employees or other agents may engage in conduct for which we might be held 
responsible.&#xA0;&#xA0;If our employees or other agents are found to have 
engaged in such practices, we could suffer severe penalties and other 
consequences that may have a material adverse effect on
our business, financial condition and results of operations.</font></div>
<div style="text-align: left; margin-left: 0px; margin-right: 0px; text-indent: 
0px"><font>&#xA0;</font></div>
<div style="text-align: left; margin-left: 0px; margin-right: 0px; text-indent: 
0px"><font>&#xA0;</font></div>
<div id="pgbrk" style="width: 100%; margin-left: 0px; text-indent: 0px; margin-
right: 0px">
<div id="ftr">
<div style="text-align: left; margin-left: 0px; margin-right: 0px; text-indent: 
0px; width: 100%"><font style="font-size: 13px; font-family: Times New 
Roman">&#xA0; </font></div>
<div style="text-align: center; margin-left: 0px; margin-right: 0px; text-
indent: 0px; width: 100%"><font style="font-size: 13px; font-family: Times New 
Roman">6</font></div></div>
<div id="pb" style="text-align: center; margin-left: 0px; margin-right: 0px; 
margin-bottom: 6px; page-break-after: always; width: 100%; height: 2px; 
background-color: #000000">
<!--page break-->
</div>
<div id="hdr">
<div style="text-align: right; margin-left: 0px; margin-right: 0px; text-indent:
0px; width: 100%"><font style="font-size: 13px; font-family: Times New 
Roman">&#xA0; </font></div></div></div>
<div style="text-align: left; margin-left: 0px; margin-right: 0px; text-indent: 
0px"><font>&#xA0;</font></div>
<div style="text-align: left; margin-left: 0px; margin-right: 0px; text-indent: 
0px">
<table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="text-align: left; width: 100%; 
font-size: 13px; font-family: Times New Roman">
<tr>
<td style="width: 10%">
<div style="text-align: left; margin-left: 0px; margin-right: 0px; text-indent: 
0px"><font style="font-weight: bold; font-size: 13px; font-family: Times New 
Roman">ITEM 1A.</font></div></td>
<td style="width: 90%">
<div style="text-align: left; margin-left: 0px; margin-right: 0px; text-indent: 
0px"><font style="font-size: 13px; font-family: Times New Roman"><font 
style="font-weight: bold">RISK FACTORS (</font><font style="font-style: 
italic">continued)</font></font></div></td></tr></table></div>
<div style="text-align: left; margin-left: 0px; margin-right: 0px; text-indent: 
0px"><font style="font-weight: bold; font-style: italic; font-size: 13px; font-
family: Times New Roman">&#xA0;</font></div>
<div style="text-align: left; margin-left: 0px; margin-right: 0px; text-indent: 
0px"><font style="font-weight: bold; font-style: italic; font-size: 13px; font-
family: Times New Roman">Current global financial and economic conditions could 
adversely impact our operations and financial condition.</font></div>
<div style="text-align: left; margin-left: 0px; margin-right: 0px; text-indent: 
0px"><font>&#xA0;</font></div>
<div style="text-align: justify; margin-left: 0px; margin-right: 0px; text-
indent: 0px"><font style="font-size: 13px; font-family: Times New Roman">Current
global financial and economic conditions, while improving, remain 
volatile.&#xA0;&#xA0;Many industries, including the mineral resource industry, 
are impacted by these market conditions.&#xA0;&#xA0;Some of the key impacts of 
the current financial market turmoil include contraction in credit markets
resulting in a widening of credit risk; devaluations and high volatility
in global equity, commodity, foreign exchange and precious metal markets; and a 
lack of market liquidity.&#xA0;&#xA0;Such factors may impact our ability to 
obtain financing on favourable terms or at all.&#xA0;&#xA0;Additionally, global 
economic conditions may cause a long term decrease in asset 
values.&#xA0;&#xA0;If such global volatility and market turmoil continue, our 
operations and financial condition could be adversely impacted.</font></div>
<div style="text-align: justify; margin-left: 0px; margin-right: 0px; text-
indent: 0px"><font style="font-weight: bold; font-size: 13px; font-family: Times
New Roman">
<br></font></div>
<div style="text-align: left; margin-left: 0px; margin-right: 0px; text-indent: 
0px"><font style="font-weight: bold; font-size: 13px; font-family: Times New 
Roman">Risks Related to Ownership of Our Common Stock</font></div>
<div style="text-align: left; margin-left: 0px; margin-right: 0px; text-indent: 
0px"><font style="font-size: 13px; font-family: Times New 
Roman">&#xA0;</font></div>
<div style="text-align: justify; margin-left: 0px; margin-right: 0px; text-
indent: 0px"><font style="font-weight: bold; font-style: italic; font-size: 
13px; font-family: Times New Roman">Because there is a limited public trading 
market for our common stock, investors may not be able to resell their 
shares.</font></div>
<div style="text-align: left; margin-left: 0px; margin-right: 0px; text-indent: 
0px"><font>&#xA0;</font></div>
<div style="text-align: justify; margin-left: 0px; margin-right: 0px; text-
indent: 0px"><font style="font-size: 13px; font-family: Times New Roman">There 
is currently a limited public trading market for our common 
stock.&#xA0;&#xA0;Therefore, there is no central place, such as stock exchange 
or electronic trading system, to resell any shares of our common 
stock.&#xA0;&#xA0;If investors wish to resell their shares, they will have to 
locate a buyer and negotiate their own sale.&#xA0;&#xA0;As a result, they may be
unable
to sell their shares or may be forced to sell them at a loss.</font></div>
<div style="text-align: left; margin-left: 0px; margin-right: 0px; text-indent: 
0px"><font>&#xA0;</font></div>
<div style="text-align: justify; margin-left: 0px; margin-right: 0px; text-
indent: 0px"><font style="font-size: 13px; font-family: Times New Roman">We 
cannot assure investors that there will be a market in the future for our common
stock.&#xA0;&#xA0;The trading of securities on the OTCQB is often sporadic and 
investors may have difficulty buying and selling our shares or obtaining market 
quotations for them, which may have a negative effect on the market price of our
common stock.&#xA0;&#xA0;Investors may not be able
to sell shares at their purchase price or at any price at all.</font></div>
<div style="text-align: left; margin-left: 0px; margin-right: 0px; text-indent: 
0px"><font>&#xA0;</font></div>
<div style="text-align: justify; margin-left: 0px; margin-right: 0px; text-
indent: 0px"><font style="font-weight: bold; font-style: italic; font-size: 
13px; font-family: Times New Roman">LSG has voting control over matters 
submitted to a vote of the stockholders, and it may take actions that conflict 
with the interests of our other stockholders and holders of our debt 
securities.</font></div>
<div style="text-align: left; margin-left: 0px; margin-right: 0px; text-indent: 
0px"><font>&#xA0;</font></div>
<div style="text-align: justify; margin-left: 0px; margin-right: 0px; text-
indent: 0px"><font style="font-size: 13px; font-family: Times New Roman">We 
issued 35,000,000 shares of our common stock to LSG on the Closing Date, and LSG
therefore controls approximately 71.2% of the votes eligible to be cast by 
stockholders in the election of directors and generally.&#xA0;&#xA0;As a result,
LSG has the power to control all matters requiring the approval of our 
stockholders, including the election of directors and the approval
of mergers and other significant corporate transactions.</font></div>
<div style="text-align: left; margin-left: 0px; margin-right: 0px; text-indent: 
0px"><font>&#xA0;</font></div>
<div style="text-align: justify; margin-left: 0px; margin-right: 0px; text-
indent: 0px"><font style="font-weight: bold; font-style: italic; font-size: 
13px; font-family: Times New Roman">The sale of securities by us in any equity 
or debt financing could result in dilution to our existing stockholders and have
a material adverse effect on our earnings.</font></div>
<div style="text-align: left; margin-left: 0px; margin-right: 0px; text-indent: 
0px"><font>&#xA0;</font></div>
<div style="text-align: justify; margin-left: 0px; margin-right: 0px; text-
indent: 0px"><font style="font-size: 13px; font-family: Times New Roman">Any 
sale of common stock by us in a future private placement offering could result 
in dilution to the existing stockholders as a direct result of our issuance of 
additional shares of our capital stock.&#xA0;&#xA0;In addition, our business 
strategy may include expansion through the acquisition of additional property 
interests or through business combinations with entities
operating in our industry.&#xA0;&#xA0;In order to do so, or to finance the cost 
of our operations, we may issue additional equity securities that could dilute 
our stockholders&#x2019; stock ownership.&#xA0;&#xA0;We may also pursue debt 
financing, if and when available, and this could negatively impact our earnings 
and results of operations. If the board of directors issues an additional class 
of voting for less than fair value, the value of your interest in the company 
will be diluted. We have no present intention
to issue any additional class of voting securities.</font></div>
<div style="text-align: left; margin-left: 0px; margin-right: 0px; text-indent: 
0px"><font>&#xA0;</font></div>
<div style="text-align: justify; margin-left: 0px; margin-right: 0px; text-
indent: 0px"><font style="font-weight: bold; font-style: italic; font-size: 
13px; font-family: Times New Roman">We are subject to penny stock regulations 
and restrictions and investors may have difficulty selling shares of our common 
stock.</font></div>
<div style="text-align: left; margin-left: 0px; margin-right: 0px; text-indent: 
0px"><font>&#xA0;</font></div>
<div style="text-align: justify; margin-left: 0px; margin-right: 0px; text-
indent: 0px"><font style="font-size: 13px; font-family: Times New Roman">Our 
common stock is subject to the provisions of Section 15(g) and Rule 15g-9 of the
Exchange Act, commonly referred to as the &#x201C;penny stock 
rules&#x201D;.&#xA0;&#xA0;Section 15(g) sets forth certain requirements for 
transactions in penny stock, and Rule 15g-9(d) incorporates the definition of 
&#x201C;penny stock&#x201D; that is found in Rule 3a51-1 of the Exchange 
Act.&#xA0;&#xA0;The
SEC generally defines a penny stock to be any equity security that has a market 
price less than $5.00 per share, subject to certain exceptions.&#xA0;&#xA0;We 
are subject to the SEC&#x2019;s penny stock rules.</font></div>
<div style="text-align: left; margin-left: 0px; margin-right: 0px; text-indent: 
0px"><font>&#xA0;</font></div>
<div style="text-align: justify; margin-left: 0px; margin-right: 0px; text-
indent: 0px"><font style="font-size: 13px; font-family: Times New Roman">Since 
our common stock is deemed to be penny stock, trading in the shares of our 
common stock is subject to additional sales practice requirements on broker-
dealers who sell penny stock to persons other than established customers and 
accredited investors.&#xA0;&#xA0;&#x201C;Accredited investors&#x201D; are 
generally persons with assets in excess of $1,000,000 (excluding
the value of such person&#x2019;s primary residence) or annual income exceeding 
$200,000 or $300,000 together with their spouse.&#xA0;&#xA0;For transactions 
covered by these rules, broker-dealers must make a special suitability 
determination for the purchase of such security and must have the 
purchaser&#x2019;s written consent to the transaction prior to the 
purchase.&#xA0;&#xA0;Additionally, for any transaction involving a penny stock, 
unless exempt, the rules require the delivery, prior to the first transaction,
of a risk disclosure document relating to the penny stock market.&#xA0;&#xA0;A 
broker-dealer also must disclose the commissions payable to both the broker-
dealer and the registered representative and current quotations for the 
securities.&#xA0;&#xA0;Finally, monthly statements must be sent disclosing 
recent price information for the penny stocks held in an account and information
to the limited market in penny stocks.</font></div>
<div style="text-align: left; margin-left: 0px; margin-right: 0px; text-indent:
0px"><font>&#xA0;</font></div>
<div id="pgbrk" style="width: 100%; margin-left: 0px; text-indent: 0px; margin-
right: 0px">
<div id="ftr">
<div style="text-align: left; margin-left: 0px; margin-right: 0px; text-indent: 
0px; width: 100%"><font style="font-size: 13px; font-family: Times New 
Roman">&#xA0; </font></div>
<div style="text-align: center; margin-left: 0px; margin-right: 0px; text-
indent: 0px; width: 100%"><font style="font-size: 13px; font-family: Times New 
Roman">7</font></div></div>
<div id="pb" style="text-align: center; margin-left: 0px; margin-right: 0px; 
margin-bottom: 6px; page-break-after: always; width: 100%; height: 2px; 
background-color: #000000">
<!--page break-->
</div>
<div id="hdr">
<div style="text-align: right; margin-left: 0px; margin-right: 0px; text-indent:
0px; width: 100%"><font style="font-size: 13px; font-family: Times New 
Roman">&#xA0; </font></div></div></div>
<div style="text-align: left; margin-left: 0px; margin-right: 0px; text-indent: 
0px"><font>&#xA0;</font></div>
<div style="text-align: left; margin-left: 0px; margin-right: 0px; text-indent: 
0px">
<table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="text-align: left; width: 100%; 
font-size: 13px; font-family: Times New Roman">
<tr>
<td style="width: 10%">
<div style="text-align: left; margin-left: 0px; margin-right: 0px; text-indent: 
0px"><font style="font-weight: bold; font-size: 13px; font-family: Times New 
Roman">ITEM 1A.</font></div></td>
<td style="width: 90%">
<div style="text-align: left; margin-left: 0px; margin-right: 0px; text-indent: 
0px"><font style="font-size: 13px; font-family: Times New Roman"><font 
style="font-weight: bold">RISK FACTORS (</font><font style="font-style: 
italic">continued)</font></font></div></td></tr></table></div>
<div style="text-align: left; margin-left: 0px; margin-right: 0px; text-indent: 
0px"><font style="font-size: 13px; font-family: Times New 
Roman">&#xA0;</font></div>
<div style="text-align: justify; margin-left: 0px; margin-right: 0px; text-
indent: 0px"><font style="font-size: 13px; font-family: Times New 
Roman">Consequently, these rules may restrict the ability of broker-dealer to 
trade and/or maintain a market in our common stock and may affect the ability of
our stockholders to sell their shares of common stock.</font></div>
<div style="text-align: left; margin-left: 0px; margin-right: 0px; text-indent: 
0px"><font>&#xA0;</font></div>
<div style="text-align: justify; margin-left: 0px; margin-right: 0px; text-
indent: 0px"><font style="font-size: 13px; font-family: Times New Roman">There 
can be no assurance that our common stock will qualify for exemption from the 
penny stock rules.&#xA0;&#xA0;In any event, even if our common stock was exempt 
from the penny stock rules, we would remain subject to Section 15(b)(6) of the 
Exchange Act, which gives the SEC the authority to restrict any person from 
participating in a distribution of penny stock if the
SEC finds that such a restriction would be in the public interest.</font></div>
<div style="text-align: left; margin-left: 0px; margin-right: 0px; text-indent: 
0px"><font>&#xA0;</font></div>
<div style="text-align: justify; margin-left: 0px; margin-right: 0px; text-
indent: 0px"><font style="font-weight: bold; font-style: italic; font-size: 
13px; font-family: Times New Roman">We do not expect to pay dividends for the 
foreseeable future.</font></div>
<div style="text-align: left; margin-left: 0px; margin-right: 0px; text-indent: 
0px"><font>&#xA0;</font></div>
<div style="text-align: justify; margin-left: 0px; margin-right: 0px; text-
indent: 0px"><font style="font-size: 13px; font-family: Times New Roman">We do 
not intend to declare dividends for the foreseeable future, as we anticipate
that we will reinvest any future earnings in the development and growth of our 
business.&#xA0;&#xA0;Therefore, our stockholders will not receive any funds 
unless they sell their common stock, and stockholders may be unable to sell 
their shares on favorable terms or at all.</font></div>
<div style="text-align: left; margin-left: 0px; margin-right: 0px; text-indent: 
0px"><font>&#xA0;</font></div>
<div style="text-align: justify; margin-left: 0px; margin-right: 0px; text-
indent: 0px"><font style="font-weight: bold; font-style: italic; font-size: 
13px; font-family: Times New Roman">Investors may face significant restrictions 
on the resale of their shares due to state &#x201C;blue sky&#x201D; 
laws.</font></div>
<div style="text-align: left; margin-left: 0px; margin-right: 0px; text-indent: 
0px"><font>&#xA0;</font></div>
<div style="text-align: justify; margin-left: 0px; margin-right: 0px; text-
indent: 0px"><font style="font-size: 13px; font-family: Times New Roman">Each 
state has its own securities laws, commonly known as &#x201C;blue sky&#x201D; 
laws, which (1) limit sales of securities to a state&#x2019;s residents unless 
the securities are registered in that state or qualify for an exemption from 
registration, and (2) govern the reporting requirements for broker-dealers doing
business directly or indirectly in the state.&#xA0;&#xA0;Before
a security is sold in a state, there must be a registration in place to cover 
the transaction, or it must be exempt from registration.&#xA0;&#xA0;The 
applicable broker-dealer must also be registered in that state.</font></div>
<div style="text-align: left; margin-left: 0px; margin-right: 0px; text-indent: 
0px"><font>&#xA0;</font></div>
<div style="text-align: justify; margin-left: 0px; margin-right: 0px; text-
indent: 0px"><font style="font-size: 13px; font-family: Times New Roman">We do 
not know whether our securities will be registered or exempt from registration 
under the laws of any state.&#xA0;&#xA0;A determination regarding registration 
will be made by those broker-dealers, if any, who agree to serve as market 
makers for our common stock.&#xA0;&#xA0;There may be significant state blue sky 
law restrictions on the ability of investors to sell,
and on purchasers to buy, our securities.&#xA0;&#xA0;Investors should therefore 
consider the resale market for our common stock to be limited, as they may be 
unable to resell their shares without the significant expense of state 
registration or qualification.</font></div>
<div style="text-align: left; margin-left: 0px; margin-right: 0px; text-indent: 
0px"><font style="font-size: 13px; font-family: Times New 
Roman">&#xA0;</font></div>
<div style="text-align: left; margin-left: 0px; margin-right: 0px; text-indent: 
0px">
<table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="text-align: left; width: 100%; 
font-size: 13px; font-family: Times New Roman">
<tr>
<td style="width: 10%">
<div style="text-align: left; margin-left: 0px; margin-right: 0px; text-indent: 
0px"><font style="font-weight: bold; font-size: 13px; font-family: Times New 
Roman">ITEM 1B.</font></div></td>
<td style="width: 90%">
<div style="text-align: left; margin-left: 0px; margin-right: 0px; text-indent: 
0px"><font style="font-weight: bold; font-size: 13px; font-family: Times New 
Roman">UNRESOLVED STAFF COMMENTS.</font></div></td></tr></table></div>
<div style="text-align: left; margin-left: 0px; margin-right: 0px; text-indent: 
0px"><font style="font-size: 13px; font-family: Times New 
Roman">&#xA0;</font></div>
<div style="text-align: left; margin-left: 0px; margin-right: 0px; text-indent: 
0px"><font style="font-size: 13px; font-family: Times New 
Roman">None.</font></div>
<div style="text-align: left; margin-left: 0px; margin-right: 0px; text-indent: 
0px"><font style="font-size: 13px; font-family: Times New 
Roman">&#xA0;</font></div>
<div style="text-align: left; margin-left: 0px; margin-right: 0px; text-indent: 
0px">
<table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="text-align: left; width: 100%;
font-size: 13px; font-family: Times New Roman">
<tr>
<td style="width: 10%">
<div style="text-align: justify; margin-left: 0px; margin-right: 0px; text-
indent: 0px"><font style="font-weight: bold; font-size: 13px; font-family: Times
New Roman">ITEM 2.</font></div></td>
<td style="width: 90%">
<div style="text-align: justify; margin-left: 0px; margin-right: 0px; text-
indent: 0px"><font style="font-weight: bold; font-size: 13px; font-family: Times
New Roman">PROPERTIES.</font></div></td></tr></table></div>
<div style="text-align: left; margin-left: 0px; margin-right: 0px; text-indent: 
0px"><font style="font-size: 13px; font-family: Times New 
Roman">&#xA0;</font></div>
<div style="text-align: justify; margin-left: 0px; margin-right: 0px; text-
indent: 0px"><font style="font-size: 13px; font-family: Times New Roman"><font 
style="background-color: #ffffff">The Property is located in west-central Nevada
(Figure 1), in the Goldfield Mining District at Latitude 37&#xB0; 42&#x2019;, 
and Longitude 117&#xB0; 14&#x2019;.&#xA0;&#xA0;The claims comprising the 
Property are located in surveyed sections 35 and 36, Township 2 South, Range 42 
East, and in sections 1, 2, 11, and 12, Township 3 South,
Range 42 East, in Esmeralda County, Nevada.&#xA0;&#xA0;The Property is 
accessible by traveling approximately one-half mile northeast of the community 
of Goldfield, along a county-maintained road that originates at U.S. Highway 95,
which runs through &#x201C;downtown&#x201D; Goldfield.&#xA0;&#xA0;The town of 
Goldfield, which is the Esmeralda county seat (population 300), is approximately
200 air miles south of Reno and 180 air miles north of Las Vegas. Surface access
on the Property is excellent and the relief is
low, at an elevation of approximately 6000 feet.&#xA0;&#xA0;Vegetation is 
sparse, consisting largely of sagebrush, rabbitbrush, Joshua trees and 
grasses.</font></font></div>
<div style="text-align: justify; margin-left: 0px; margin-right: 0px; text-
indent: 0px"><font style="font-size: 13px; font-family: Times New 
Roman">&#xA0;</font></div>
<div style="text-align: justify; margin-left: 0px; margin-right: 0px; text-
indent: 0px"><font style="font-size: 13px; font-family: Times New Roman"><font 
style="background-color: #ffffff">The Property consists of 31 patented claims 
and 1 unpatented millsite claim (Figure 2), covering a total of approximately 
460 acres, or 186 hectares.&#xA0;&#xA0;Only the single unpatented claim is 
administered by the United States Bureau of Land Management, and annual 
assessment filings and payments are due on it.&#xA0;&#xA0;The
patented claims are owned as private land by LSG, and only annual property taxes
must be paid.</font></font></div>
<div style="text-align: justify; margin-left: 0px; margin-right: 0px; text-
indent: 0px"><font>&#xA0;</font></div>
<div style="text-align: justify; margin-left: 0px; margin-right: 0px; text-
indent: 0px"><font>&#xA0;</font></div>
<div style="text-align: left; margin-left: 0px; margin-right: 0px; text-indent: 
0px"><font>&#xA0;</font></div>
<div id="pgbrk" style="width: 100%; margin-left: 0px; text-indent: 0px; margin-
right: 0px">
<div id="ftr">
<div style="text-align: left; margin-left: 0px; margin-right: 0px; text-indent: 
0px; width: 100%"><font style="font-size: 13px; font-family: Times New 
Roman">&#xA0; </font></div>
<div style="text-align: center; margin-left: 0px; margin-right: 0px; text-
indent: 0px; width: 100%"><font style="font-size: 13px; font-family: Times New 
Roman">8</font></div></div>
<div id="pb" style="text-align: center; margin-left: 0px; margin-right: 0px; 
margin-bottom: 6px; page-break-after: always; width: 100%; height: 2px; 
background-color: #000000">
<!--page break-->
</div>

<div style="text-align: left; margin-left: 0px; margin-right: 0px; text-indent:

<td style="width: 90%">

<div style="text-align: right; margin-left: 0px; margin-right: 0px; text-indent:

<div style="text-align: left; margin-left: 0px; margin-right: 0px; text-indent:

0px">

font-size: 13px; font-family: Times New Roman">
<tr>
<td style="width: 10%">
<div style="text-align: justify; margin-left: 0px; margin-right: 0px; text-
indent: 0px"><font style="font-weight: bold; font-size: 13px; font-family: Times
New Roman">ITEM 2.</font></div></td>
<td style="width: 90%">
<div style="text-align: justify; margin-left: 0px; margin-right: 0px; text-
indent: 0px"><font style="font-size: 13px; font-family: Times New Roman"><font 
style="font-weight: bold">PROPERTIES. </font><font style="font-style: 
italic">(continued)</font></font></div></td></tr></table></div>
<div style="text-align: left; margin-left: 0px; margin-right: 0px; text-indent: 
0px"><font>&#xA0;</font></div>
<div style="text-align: left; margin-left: 0px; margin-right: 0px; text-indent:

is current, including information about a company&#x2019;s reporting status, 
company profile, information on management and boards,

Roman;display:inline-block;">0.55</font><font style="text-align: left; vertical-
align:bottom;width:10%;font-size:13px;font-family:Times New 
Roman;display:inline-block;">&#xA0; </font></div></td>
<td colspan="1" style="vertical-align: bottom; width: 15%;">
<div><font style="text-align: left; vertical-align:bottom;width:10%;font-

0, 0);">
<div style="text-align: left; text-indent: 0px; margin-right: 0px; margin-left:
0px;">
<div style="text-align: left; margin-left: 0px; margin-right: 0px; text-indent: 
0px"><font style="font-size: 13px; font-family: Times New Roman">March 
31</font></div></div></td>
<td colspan="1" style="vertical-align: bottom; width: 15%; border-bottom: 2px 
solid rgb(0, 0, 0);">
<div><font style="text-align: left; font-family: Times New Roman; vertical-

</font><font style="text-align: left; font-family: Times New Roman; vertical-
align: bottom; display: inline-block; width: 5%; font-size: 13px;">$</font><font
style="text-align: right; font-family: Times New Roman; vertical-align: bottom;
