    <us-gaap:BusinessDescriptionAndBasisOfPresentationTextBlock 
contextRef="From2015-01-01to2015-12-31">&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, 
Times, Serif; margin: 0"&gt;&lt;font style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, 
Serif"&gt;&lt;b&gt;Organization&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p 
style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0"&gt;&lt;font 
style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, 
Serif"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt 
Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0"&gt;&lt;font style="font: 8pt Times New
Roman, Times, Serif"&gt;Lode-Star&#13;Mining Inc. (formerly International Gold 
Corp.) (&amp;#147;the Company&amp;#148;) was incorporated in the State of 
Nevada, U.S.A., on&#13;December 9, 2004.&amp;#160;&amp;#160;The 
Company&amp;#146;s principal executive offices are located in Cypress, 
Texas.&amp;#160;&amp;#160;The Company&#13;was originally formed for the purpose 
of acquiring exploration stage natural resource properties. The Company acquired
a mineral&#13;property interest from Lode Star Gold Inc., a private Nevada 
corporation (&amp;#147;LSG&amp;#148;) on December 11, 2014 (See Note 4)&#13;in 
consideration for the issuance of 35,000,000 common shares of the 
Company.&amp;#160;As a result of this transaction, control of&#13;the Company 
was acquired by 
LSG.&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt
;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0"&gt;&lt;font 
style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, 
Serif"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt 
Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0"&gt;&lt;font style="font: 8pt Times New
Roman, Times, Serif"&gt;On&#13;May 12, 2015, International Gold Corp. completed 
a merger with its wholly owned subsidiary, Lode-Star Mining Inc., and 
formally&#13;assumed the subsidiary&amp;#146;s name by filing Articles of Merger
with the Nevada Secretary of State (the &amp;#147;Name 
Change&amp;#148;).&amp;#160;&#13;The subsidiary was incorporated entirely for 
the purpose of effecting the Name Change and the merger did not affect the
Company&amp;#146;s&#13;corporate structure in any other 
way.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, 
Times, Serif; margin: 0"&gt;&lt;font style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, 
Serif"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt 
Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0"&gt;&lt;font style="font: 8pt Times New
Roman, Times, 
Serif"&gt;&lt;b&gt;Going&#13;Concern&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&
lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0"&gt;&lt;font 
style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, 
Serif"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt 
Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0"&gt;&lt;font style="font: 8pt Times New
Roman, Times, Serif"&gt;The&#13;accompanying financial statements have been 
prepared assuming the Company will continue as a going 
concern.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman,
Times, Serif; margin: 0"&gt;&lt;font style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, 
Serif"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt 
Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0"&gt;&lt;font style="font: 8pt Times New
Roman, Times, Serif"&gt;The&#13;future of the Company is dependent upon its 
ability to establish a business and to obtain new financing to execute 
its&#13;business plan. As shown in the accompanying financial statements, the 
Company has had no revenue and has incurred restated&#13;accumulated losses of 
$1,412,024 for the period from December 9, 2004 (inception) to December 31 
2015.&amp;#160;&amp;#160;There is no&#13;assurance that management&amp;#146;s 
plans to seek additional capital through private placements of its common stock 
will be&#13;realized, and these factors cast substantial doubt upon the use of 
the going concern assumption. These financial statements&#13;do not include any 
adjustments relating to the recoverability and classification of recorded 
assets, or the amounts of and&#13;classification of liabilities that might be 
necessary in the event the Company cannot continue in 
existence.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;</us-
gaap:BusinessDescriptionAndBasisOfPresentationTextBlock>
    <us-gaap:SignificantAccountingPoliciesTextBlock contextRef="From2015-01-
01to2015-12-31">&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 
0"&gt;&lt;font style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, 
Serif"&gt;The&#13;financial statements of the Company have been prepared in 
accordance with generally accepted accounting principles in the 
United&#13;States (&amp;#147;GAAP&amp;#148;).&amp;#160;&amp;#160;Because a 
precise determination of many assets and liabilities is dependent upon 
future&#13;events, the preparation of financial statements for a period 
necessarily involves the use of estimates which have been made using&#13;careful
judgment.&amp;#160;&amp;#160;All dollar amounts are in U.S. dollars unless 
otherwise noted.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times 
New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0"&gt;&lt;font style="font: 8pt Times New

style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0"&gt;&lt;font 
style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif"&gt;The&#13;financial statements 
have, in management&amp;#146;s opinion, been properly prepared within reasonable
limits of materiality and within&#13;the framework of the significant accounting
policies summarized below:&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 
8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0"&gt;&lt;font style="font: 8pt Times

management,&#13;all adjustments, consisting of normal recurring adjustments, 
necessary for a fair presentation of financial position and the results&#13;of 
operations for the periods presented have been reflected 
herein.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman,

major financial institutions. &amp;#160;For purposes of the balance sheets and 
statements&#13;of cash flows, the Company considers all highly liquid debt 
instruments purchased with maturity of 90 days or less to be 
cash&#13;equivalents. At December 31, 2015 and 2014, the Company had no cash

font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif"&gt;&lt;font style="font: 8pt Times New 
Roman, Times, Serif"&gt;d)&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style="width: 
96%; font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif"&gt;&lt;font style="font:
 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif"&gt;Fair&#13;    Value of Financial 
Instruments&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;&#13;&lt;/table&gt;&#13;&lt;p 
style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0"&gt;&lt;font 
style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, 
Serif"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt 
Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0"&gt;&lt;font style="font: 8pt Times New
Roman, Times, Serif"&gt;ASC&#13;Topic 820-10 establishes a three-tier value 
hierarchy, which prioritizes the inputs used in measuring fair 
value.&amp;#160;&amp;#160;The&#13;hierarchy prioritizes the inputs into three 
levels based on the extent to which inputs used in measuring fair value are 
observable&#13;in the market. These tiers 
include:&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;table cellspacing="0" 
cellpadding="0" style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; width: 
100%"&gt;&#13;&lt;tr style="vertical-align: top; font: 8pt Times New Roman, 
Times, Serif"&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style="width: 7%; font: 8pt Times New Roman, 
Times, Serif"&gt;&lt;font style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, 
Serif"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style="width: 3%; 
font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif"&gt;&lt;font style="font: 8pt Times New 
Roman, Times, Serif"&gt;&amp;#167;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td 
style="width: 90%; font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif"&gt;&lt;font 
style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif"&gt;Level&#13;    1 &amp;#150; 
defined as observable inputs such as quoted prices in active 
markets;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;&#13;&lt;tr style="vertical-align: 
top; font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif"&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style="font: 
8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif"&gt;&lt;font style="font: 8pt Times New Roman,
Times, Serif"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style="font: 
8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif"&gt;&lt;font style="font: 8pt Times New Roman,
Times, Serif"&gt;&amp;#167;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style="font:
8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif"&gt;&lt;font style="font: 8pt Times New Roman,
Times, Serif"&gt;Level&#13;    2 &amp;#150; defined as inputs other than quoted 
prices in active markets that are either directly or indirectly observable;&#13;
and&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;&#13;&lt;/table&gt;&#13;&lt;p style="font:
8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0"&gt;&lt;font style="font: 8pt Times
New Roman, Times, Serif"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;table
cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; 
width: 100%"&gt;&#13;&lt;tr style="vertical-align: top; font: 8pt Times New 
Roman, Times, Serif"&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style="width: 7%; font: 8pt Times New 
Roman, Times, Serif"&gt;&lt;font style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, 
Serif"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style="width: 3%; 
font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif"&gt;&lt;font style="font: 8pt Times New 
Roman, Times, Serif"&gt;&amp;#167;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td 
style="width: 90%; font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif"&gt;&lt;font 
style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif"&gt;Level&#13;    3 &amp;#150; 
defined as unobservable inputs in which little or no market data exists, 
therefore requiring an entity to develop&#13;    its own 
assumptions.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;&#13;&lt;/table&gt;&#13;&lt;p 
style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0"&gt;&lt;font 
style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, 
Serif"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt 
Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0"&gt;&lt;font style="font: 8pt Times New
Roman, Times, Serif"&gt;The&#13;Company&amp;#146;s financial instruments consist
of cash, accounts payable and accrued liabilities, and loans payable. The 
Company&#13;is not exposed to significant interest, currency or credit risks 
arising from these financial instruments. Pursuant to ASC 820&#13;and 825, the 
fair value of cash is determined based on &amp;#147;Level 1&amp;#148; inputs, 
which consist of quoted prices in active&#13;markets for identical assets. 
Accounts payable and accrued liabilities and loans payable are measured using 
&amp;#147;Level 2&amp;#148;&#13;inputs as there are no quoted prices in active 
markets for identical instruments.&amp;#160;&amp;#160;The carrying values of 
cash, accounts&#13;payable and accrued liabilities, and loans payable 
approximate their fair values due to the immediate or short term maturity 
of&#13;these financial instruments.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p 
style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0"&gt;&lt;font 
style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, 
Serif"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;table cellspacing="0" 
cellpadding="0" style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; width: 
100%"&gt;&#13;&lt;tr style="vertical-align: top; font: 8pt Times New Roman, 
Times, Serif"&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style="width: 2%; font: 8pt Times New Roman, 
Times, Serif"&gt;&lt;font style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, 
Serif"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style="width: 2%; 
font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif"&gt;&lt;font style="font: 8pt Times New 
Roman, Times, Serif"&gt;e)&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style="width: 
96%; font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif"&gt;&lt;font style="font: 8pt Times
New Roman, Times, Serif"&gt;Asset&#13;    Retirement 
Obligations&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;&#13;&lt;/table&gt;&#13;&lt;p 
style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0"&gt;&lt;font 
style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, 
Serif"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt 
Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0"&gt;&lt;font style="font: 8pt Times New
Roman, Times, Serif"&gt;The&#13;Company has no asset retirement obligations, 
including environmental rehabilitation expenditures, which relate to an 
existing&#13;condition caused by past 
operations.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New 
Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0"&gt;&lt;font style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, 
Times, Serif"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;table 
cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; 
width: 100%"&gt;&#13;&lt;tr style="vertical-align: top; font: 8pt Times New 
Roman, Times, Serif"&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style="width: 2%; font: 8pt Times New 
Roman, Times, Serif"&gt;&lt;font style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, 
Serif"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style="width: 2%; 
font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif"&gt;&lt;font style="font: 8pt Times New 
Roman, Times, Serif"&gt;f)&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style="width:
96%; font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif"&gt;&lt;font style="font: 8pt Times
New Roman, Times, Serif"&gt;Use&#13;    of Estimates and 
Assumptions&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;&#13;&lt;/table&gt;&#13;&lt;p 
style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0"&gt;&lt;font 
style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, 
Serif"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt 
Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0"&gt;&lt;font style="font: 8pt Times New
Roman, Times, Serif"&gt;The&#13;preparation of financial statements, in 
conformity with GAAP, requires management to make estimates and assumptions that
affect&#13;the amounts reported in the financial statements and accompanying 
disclosures.&amp;#160;&amp;#160;By their nature, these estimates are&#13;subject
to measurement uncertainty and the effect on the financial statements of changes
in such estimates in future periods could&#13;be 
significant.&amp;#160;&amp;#160;Significant areas requiring 
management&amp;#146;s estimates and assumptions are determining the fair 
value&#13;of transactions involving related parties and common 
stock.&amp;#160;&amp;#160;Actual results may differ from the 
estimates.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New 
Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0"&gt;&lt;font style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, 
Times, Serif"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;table 
cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; 
width: 100%"&gt;&#13;&lt;tr style="vertical-align: top; font: 8pt Times New 
Roman, Times, Serif"&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style="width: 2%; font: 8pt Times New 
Roman, Times, Serif"&gt;&lt;font style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, 
Serif"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style="width: 2%; 
font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif"&gt;&lt;font style="font: 8pt Times New 
Roman, Times, Serif"&gt;g)&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style="width: 
96%; font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif"&gt;&lt;font style="font: 8pt Times
New Roman, Times, Serif"&gt;Basic&#13;    and Diluted Earnings Per 
Share&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;&#13;&lt;/table&gt;&#13;&lt;p 
style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0"&gt;&lt;font 
style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, 
Serif"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt 
Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0"&gt;&lt;font style="font: 8pt Times New
Roman, Times, Serif"&gt;The&#13;Company reports basic earnings or loss per share
in accordance with ASC Topic 260, &amp;#147;Earnings Per 
Share&amp;#148;.&amp;#160;Basic&#13;earnings per share is computed by dividing 
net earnings available to common stockholders by the weighted average number of 
common&#13;shares outstanding during the period.&amp;#160;Diluted earnings per 
share is computed similarly, except that the common stock number&#13;is 
increased to include the any potential additional common shares, for example 
from the exercise of options or warrants. As the&#13;Company generated net 
losses in the periods presented, the additional impact of including potential 
shares from outstanding warrants&#13;would
 be anti-dilutive and is therefore not part of the earnings per share 
calculation.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New 
Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0"&gt;&lt;font style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, 
Times, Serif"&gt;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;table 
cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; 
width: 100%"&gt;&#13;&lt;tr style="vertical-align: top; font: 8pt Times New 
Roman, Times, Serif"&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style="width: 2%; font: 8pt Times New 
Roman, Times, Serif"&gt;&lt;font style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, 
Serif"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style="width: 2%; 
font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif"&gt;&lt;font style="font: 8pt Times New 
Roman, Times, Serif"&gt;h)&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style="width: 
96%; font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif"&gt;&lt;font style="font: 8pt Times
New Roman, Times, Serif"&gt;Income&#13;    
Taxes&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;&#13;&lt;/table&gt;&#13;&lt;p 
style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0"&gt;&lt;font 
style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, 
Serif"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt 
Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0"&gt;&lt;font style="font: 8pt Times New
Roman, Times, Serif"&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 
8pt/normal Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0 0 0 0pt; text-align:
justify"&gt;The Company uses the asset and&#13;liability method of accounting 
for income taxes in accordance with ASC Topic 740, Income 
Taxes.&amp;#160;&amp;#160;This standard requires&#13;the use of an asset and 
liability approach for financial accounting and reporting on income 
taxes.&amp;#160;&amp;#160;If it is more likely&#13;than not that some portion or
all of a deferred tax asset will not be realized, a valuation allowance is 
recognized.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman,
Times, Serif; margin: 0"&gt;&lt;font style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, 
Serif"&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New 
Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0"&gt;&lt;font style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, 
Times, Serif"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;table 
cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; 
width: 100%"&gt;&#13;&lt;tr style="vertical-align: top; font: 8pt Times New 
Roman, Times, Serif"&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style="width: 2%; font: 8pt Times New 
Roman, Times, Serif"&gt;&lt;font style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, 
Serif"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style="width: 2%; 
font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif"&gt;&lt;font style="font: 8pt Times New 
Roman, Times, Serif"&gt;i)&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style="width: 
96%; font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif"&gt;&lt;font style="font: 8pt Times
New Roman, Times, Serif"&gt;Stock-Based&#13;    
Compensation&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;&#13;&lt;/table&gt;&#13;&lt;p 
style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0"&gt;&lt;font 
style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, 
Serif"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt 
Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0"&gt;&lt;font style="font: 8pt Times New
Roman, Times, Serif"&gt;Stock-based&#13;compensation is accounted for in 
accordance with ASC 718 whereby a compensation charge based on the fair value of
the award is&#13;recorded against earnings over the period during which the 
employee is required to perform the services in exchange for the award&#13;
(generally the vesting period). For transactions with non-employees in which 
services are performed in exchange for the Company&amp;#146;s&#13;common stock 
or other equity instruments, the transactions are recorded on the basis of the 
fair value of the service received&#13;or the fair value of the equity 
instruments issued, whichever is more readily measurable at the date of 
issuance. The expense&#13;is recognized over the vesting period of the 
award.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, 
Times, Serif; margin: 0"&gt;&lt;font style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, 
Serif"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;table cellspacing="0" 
cellpadding="0" style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; width: 
100%"&gt;&#13;&lt;tr style="vertical-align: top; font: 8pt Times New Roman, 
Times, Serif"&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style="width: 2%; font: 8pt Times New Roman, 
Times, Serif"&gt;&lt;font style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, 
Serif"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style="width: 2%; 
font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif"&gt;&lt;font style="font: 8pt Times New 
Roman, Times, Serif"&gt;j)&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td 
style="width: 96%; font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif"&gt;&lt;font 
style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif"&gt;Mineral&#13;    Property 
Interest and 
Impairment&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;&#13;&lt;/table&gt;&#13;&lt;p 
style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0"&gt;&lt;font 
style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, 
Serif"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt 
Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0"&gt;&lt;font style="font: 8pt Times New
Roman, Times, Serif"&gt;Mineral&#13;property interests are capitalized and 
recorded at fair value. The property interests are periodically assessed for 
impairment&#13;of value when facts and circumstances suggest that the carrying 
amount of the property interest may exceed its recoverable amount.&#13;Costs of 
exploration, evaluation and retaining mineral property interests are expensed as
incurred. Once the Company has identified&#13;proven and probable reserves in 
its investigation of its property interests and upon development of a plan for 
operating a mine,&#13;it would enter the development stage and capitalize future
costs until production is established. When a property reaches 
the&#13;production stage, the related capital costs will be amortized, using the
units-of-production method over proven and probable
reserves.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New 
Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0"&gt;&lt;font style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, 
Times, Serif"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;table 
cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; 
width: 100%"&gt;&#13;&lt;tr style="vertical-align: top; font: 8pt Times New 
Roman, Times, Serif"&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style="width: 2%; font: 8pt Times New 
Roman, Times, Serif"&gt;&lt;font style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, 
Serif"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style="width: 2%; 
font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif"&gt;&lt;font style="font: 8pt Times New 
Roman, Times, Serif"&gt;k)&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style="width: 
96%; font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif"&gt;&lt;font style="font: 8pt Times
New Roman, Times, Serif"&gt;Recent&#13;    Accounting 
Pronouncements&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;&#13;&lt;/table&gt;&#13;&lt;p 
style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0"&gt;&lt;font 
style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, 
Serif"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt 
Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0"&gt;&lt;font style="font: 8pt Times New
Roman, Times, Serif"&gt;The&#13;Company has implemented all applicable new 
accounting pronouncements that are in effect. Those pronouncements did not have 
any&#13;material impact on the financial statements unless otherwise disclosed, 
and the Company does not believe that there are any other&#13;new accounting 
pronouncements that have been issued that might have a material impact on its 
financial position or results of&#13;operations.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;</us-
gaap:SignificantAccountingPoliciesTextBlock>
    <us-gaap:StockholdersEquityNoteDisclosureTextBlock contextRef="From2015-01-
01to2015-12-31">&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 
0"&gt;&lt;font style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif"&gt;During&#13;the
year ended December 31, 2015, the Company had no cash subscriptions for shares 
of its common stock.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt 
Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0"&gt;&lt;font style="font: 8pt Times New
Roman, Times, Serif"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p 
style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0"&gt;&lt;font 
style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif"&gt;On&#13;November 11, 2015, the
Company entered into a one year agreement to obtain assistance in conducting 
business strategy and communications&#13;planning, public financial disclosure 
reporting, and various matters in connection with directors and other 
professionals as needed&#13;by the Company. In consideration for the services to
be provided, the Company granted the consultant 1,469,825 shares of 
common&#13;stock. Those shares were issued on December 11, 2015 and were valued 
at $29,397, based on market price at the date of the agreement.&#13;In addition,
the consultant was granted warrants with a five year term, commencing the date 
of the agreement, to purchase 3,336,060&#13;shares of common stock at a price of
$0.02 per share, including a cashless exercise option. The warrants were valued 
at $66,721&#13;using the Black-Scholes option pricing model with an average 
risk-free rate of 1.68%, estimated life of 5 years, volatility of&#13;208.7% and
dividend yield of 0%.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt 
Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0"&gt;&lt;font style="font: 8pt Times New
Roman, Times, Serif"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p 
style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0"&gt;&lt;font 
style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif"&gt;On&#13;January 9, 2015, 
agreements were reached in connection with the loans of $24,696 (CAD $28,650) 
and $1,767 (CAD $2,050) whereby&#13;the loan amounts were to be converted to 
Company shares at a price of CAD $0.05, to result in the issuance of 573,000 and
41,000&#13;common shares respectively. Those shares were issued on April 6, 
2015.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, 
Times, Serif; margin: 0"&gt;&lt;font style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, 
Serif"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt 
Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0"&gt;&lt;font style="font: 8pt Times New
Roman, Times, Serif"&gt;On&#13;January 9, 2015, an agreement was reached to 
modify the terms of a loan such that $26,750 of accrued interest together with 
a&#13;premium was to be converted to Company shares at a price of $0.05 per 
share, to result in the issuance of 535,000 common shares.&#13;Those shares were
issued on April 6, 2015.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt 
Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0"&gt;&lt;font style="font: 8pt Times New
Roman, Times, Serif"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p 
style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0"&gt;&lt;font 
style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif"&gt;During&#13;the year ended 
December 31, 2014, the Company received no cash subscriptions for shares of its 
common stock, however, on December&#13;11, 2014, the Company issued 35,000,000 
shares, valued at $230,180, in exchange for the mineral property interest 
described in&#13;Note 4.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt 
Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0"&gt;&lt;font style="font: 8pt Times New
Roman, Times, Serif"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p 
style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0"&gt;&lt;font 
style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, 
Serif"&gt;&lt;b&gt;Capitalization&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;
p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0"&gt;&lt;font 
style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, 
Serif"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt 
Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0"&gt;&lt;font style="font: 8pt Times New
Roman, Times, Serif"&gt;On&#13;November 24, 2015, the board of directors 
authorized the following changes to the capitalization of the 
Company:&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman,
Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-indent: 0.5in"&gt;&lt;font style="font: 8pt Times 
New Roman, Times, Serif"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p 
style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0"&gt;&lt;font 
style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif"&gt;The&#13;authorized capital 
was increased from 100,000,000 shares of common stock with a par value of 
$0.00001 per share to 500,000,000&#13;shares of capital stock, divided into 
480,000,000 shares of common stock with a par value of $0.001 per share, and 
20,000,000&#13;shares of preferred stock with a par value of $0.001 per share. 
The Company reserved 10,000,000 shares of common stock for issuance&#13;under 
its new 2016 Omnibus Equity Incentive Plan. To date, warrants to purchase 
3,336,060 shares of common stock have been issued&#13;under the Equity Incentive
Plan and none of those warrants have been 
exercised.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New 
Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0"&gt;&lt;font style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, 
Times, Serif"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 
8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0"&gt;&lt;font style="font: 8pt Times
New Roman, Times, Serif"&gt;No&#13;preferred shares have been issued to the date
of issue of these financial statements.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p 
style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0"&gt;&lt;font 
style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, 
Serif"&gt;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p

    <us-gaap:DebtDisclosureTextBlock contextRef="From2015-01-01to2015-12-
31">&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0"&gt;&lt;font
style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif"&gt;At&#13;December 31, 2015, the
Company had the following loans payable:&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p 
style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0"&gt;&lt;font 
style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, 
Serif"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;table cellspacing="0" 
cellpadding="0" style="width: 100%; font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times,

the Company entered into a consulting agreement whereby the former sole director
and officer of the Company was&#13;to provide services as the Company&amp;#146;s
CEO, COO, CFO and Corporate Secretary. The consulting agreement, which would 
otherwise&#13;have extended to June 2016, was terminated with immediate effect 
in accordance with a settlement agreement dated December 5, 
2014.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman,

CAD.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;&#13;&lt;tr style="vertical-align: top; 
font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif"&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style="font: 8pt 
Times New Roman, Times, Serif"&gt;&lt;font style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, 
Times, Serif"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style="font: 
8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif"&gt;&lt;font style="font: 8pt Times New Roman,
Times, Serif"&gt;&amp;#183;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style="font: 
8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif"&gt;&lt;font style="font: 8pt Times New Roman,
Times, Serif"&gt;Of&#13;    that amount, $Nil was outstanding and included in 
accounts payable at December 31, 2015 (December 31, 2014: $15,300 ($17,500&#13; 
CAD).&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;&#13;&lt;/table&gt;</us-
gaap:CommitmentsDisclosureTextBlock>
    <us-gaap:IncomeTaxDisclosureTextBlock contextRef="From2015-01-01to2015-12-
31">&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0"&gt;&lt;font
style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif"&gt;In&#13;December, 2014, the 
Company underwent a change in control which subjected it to limitations under 
Internal Revenue Code Section&#13;382. That section restricts post-change annual
net operating loss utilization, based on applying an IRS- prescribed rate to 
the&#13;purchase price of the stock acquired in the change in control. The 
Company accordingly revised its estimates of net operating&#13;loss carry 
forwards, resulting in a reduction in the estimate of losses available for 
utilization in the amount of 
approximately&#13;$872,000.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 
8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0"&gt;&lt;font style="font: 8pt Times
New Roman, Times, Serif"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p 
style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0"&gt;&lt;font 
style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif"&gt;A&#13;reconciliation of 
income tax benefit to the amount computed at the statutory rate of 34% (2014 
&amp;#150; 34%) is as follows:&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p 
style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0"&gt;&lt;font 
style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times,

Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0"&gt;&lt;font style="font: 8pt Times New
Roman, Times, Serif"&gt;Realization&#13;of the above losses carried forward is 
dependent on the Company filing the applicable tax returns with the tax 
authorities, generating&#13;sufficient taxable income prior to expiration of the
losses carried forward and continuing use of the acquired historic 
business&#13;or a significant portion of the acquired assets for two years after
the change of control transaction. If this &lt;i&gt;continuity of&#13;business 
enterprise&lt;/i&gt; requirement is not met, the annual net operating loss 
limitation on pre-change losses is zero.&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;</us-
gaap:IncomeTaxDisclosureTextBlock>
    <us-gaap:SubsequentEventsTextBlock contextRef="From2015-01-01to2015-12-
31">&lt;p style="margin: 0pt; font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, 
Serif"&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, 
Serif; margin: 0"&gt;&lt;font style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, 
Serif"&gt;Management&#13;has evaluated subsequent events and the impact on the 
reported results and disclosures and has concluded that no other 
significant&#13;events require disclosure as of the date these financial 
statements were issued.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&#13;&#13;&lt;p 
style="margin: 0pt; font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif"&gt;&lt;/p&gt;</us-
gaap:SubsequentEventsTextBlock>
    <us-gaap:BasisOfAccountingPolicyPolicyTextBlock contextRef="From2015-01-
01to2015-12-31">&lt;p style="font: 8pt/normal Times New Roman, Times, Serif;
margin: 0"&gt;The Company&amp;#146;s financial statements have been 
prepared&#13;using the accrual method of accounting. In the opinion of 
management, all adjustments, consisting of normal recurring 
adjustments,&#13;necessary for a fair presentation of financial position and the
results of operations for the periods presented have been 
reflected&#13;herein.&lt;/p&gt;</us-gaap:BasisOfAccountingPolicyPolicyTextBlock>
    <us-gaap:CashAndCashEquivalentsPolicyTextBlock contextRef="From2015-01-
01to2015-12-31">&lt;p style="font: 8pt/normal Times New Roman, Times, Serif; 
margin: 0"&gt;Cash consists of cash on deposit with high quality major 
financial&#13;institutions. &amp;#160;For purposes of the balance sheets and 
statements of cash flows, the Company considers all highly liquid 
debt&#13;instruments purchased with maturity of 90 days or less to be cash 
equivalents. At December 31, 2015 and 2014, the Company had no&#13;cash 
equivalents.&lt;/p&gt;</us-gaap:CashAndCashEquivalentsPolicyTextBlock>
    <us-gaap:ForeignCurrencyTransactionsAndTranslationsPolicyTextBlock 
contextRef="From2015-01-01to2015-12-31">&lt;p style="font: 8pt/normal Times New 
Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0"&gt;The Company&amp;#146;s functional currency is
the U.S. dollar.&amp;#160;&amp;#160;Branch&#13;office activities are generally 
in Canadian dollars. Transactions in Canadian currency are translated into U.S. 
dollars as follows:&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt/normal Times New 
Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-indent: 
0.5in"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;table cellspacing="0" 
cellpadding="0" style="font: 11pt Calibri, Helvetica, Sans-Serif; width: 
100%"&gt;&#13;&lt;tr style="vertical-align: top"&gt;&#13;    &lt;td 
style="width: 6%; line-height: 107%"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td 
style="width: 2%; line-height: 107%"&gt;&lt;font style="font: 8pt Times New 
Roman, Times, Serif"&gt;i)&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style="width: 
92%; line-height: 107%"&gt;&lt;font style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, 
Serif"&gt;monetary items at the exchange rate prevailing at the balance sheet 
date;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;&#13;&lt;tr style="vertical-align: 
top"&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style="line-height: 107%"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/td&gt;&#13; 
&lt;td style="line-height: 107%"&gt;&lt;font style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, 
Times, Serif"&gt;ii)&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style="line-height: 
107%"&gt;&lt;font style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif"&gt;non-
monetary items at the historical exchange rate; 
and&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;&#13;&lt;/table&gt;&#13;&lt;p style="font:
8pt/normal Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-indent: 
0.5in"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;table cellspacing="0" 
cellpadding="0" style="font: 11pt Calibri, Helvetica, Sans-Serif; width: 
100%"&gt;&#13;&lt;tr style="vertical-align: top"&gt;&#13;    &lt;td 
style="width: 6%; line-height: 107%"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td 
style="width: 2%; line-height: 107%"&gt;&lt;font style="font: 8pt Times New 
Roman, Times, Serif"&gt;iii)&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td 
style="width: 92%; line-height: 107%"&gt;&lt;font style="font: 8pt Times New 
Roman, Times, Serif"&gt;revenue and expense items at the rate in effect of the 
date of 
transactions.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;&#13;&lt;/table&gt;&#13;&lt;p 
style="font: 8pt/normal Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-indent: 
0.5in"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt/normal Times New 
Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0"&gt;Gains and losses arising on the settlement of
foreign currency&#13;denominated transactions or balances are recorded in the 
statements of operations.&lt;/p&gt;</us-
gaap:ForeignCurrencyTransactionsAndTranslationsPolicyTextBlock>
    <us-gaap:FairValueOfFinancialInstrumentsPolicy contextRef="From2015-01-
01to2015-12-31">&lt;p style="font: 8pt/normal Times New Roman, Times, Serif; 
margin: 0"&gt;ASC Topic 820-10 establishes a three-tier value 
hierarchy,&#13;which prioritizes the inputs used in measuring fair 
value.&amp;#160;&amp;#160;The hierarchy prioritizes the inputs into three levels
based&#13;on the extent to which inputs used in measuring fair value are 
observable in the market. These tiers include:&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;table 
cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" style="font: 11pt Calibri, Helvetica, Sans-
Serif; width: 100%"&gt;&#13;&lt;tr style="vertical-align: top"&gt;&#13;    
&lt;td style="width: 6%; line-height: 107%"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    
&lt;td style="width: 2%; line-height: 107%"&gt;&lt;font style="font: 8pt Times
New Roman, Times, Serif"&gt;&amp;#167;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td 
style="width: 92%; line-height: 107%"&gt;&lt;font style="font: 8pt Times New 
Roman, Times, Serif"&gt;Level 1 &amp;#150; defined as observable inputs such as 
quoted prices in active markets;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;&#13;&lt;tr 
style="vertical-align: top"&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style="line-height: 
107%"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style="line-height: 
107%"&gt;&lt;font style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, 
Serif"&gt;&amp;#167;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style="line-height: 
107%"&gt;&lt;font style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif"&gt;Level 2 
&amp;#150; defined as inputs other than quoted prices in active markets that are
either directly or indirectly observable; 
and&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;&#13;&lt;/table&gt;&#13;&lt;p style="font:
8pt/normal Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-indent: 
0.5in"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;table cellspacing="0" 
cellpadding="0" style="font: 11pt Calibri, Helvetica, Sans-Serif; width: 
100%"&gt;&#13;&lt;tr style="vertical-align: top"&gt;&#13;    &lt;td 
style="width: 6%; line-height: 107%"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td 
style="width: 2%; line-height: 107%"&gt;&lt;font style="font: 8pt Times New 
Roman, Times, Serif"&gt;&amp;#167;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td 
style="width: 92%; line-height: 107%"&gt;&lt;font style="font: 8pt Times New 
Roman, Times, Serif"&gt;Level 3 &amp;#150; defined as unobservable inputs in 
which little or no market data exists, therefore requiring an entity to develop 
its own 
assumptions.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;&#13;&lt;/table&gt;&#13;&lt;p 
style="font: 8pt/normal Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-indent: 
0.5in"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt/normal Times New 
Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0"&gt;The Company&amp;#146;s financial instruments 
consist of cash,&#13;accounts payable and accrued liabilities, and loans 
payable. The Company is not exposed to significant interest, currency or 
credit&#13;risks arising from these financial instruments. Pursuant to ASC 820 
and 825, the fair value of cash is determined based on 
&amp;#147;Level&#13;1&amp;#148; inputs, which consist of quoted prices in active
markets for identical assets. Accounts payable and accrued liabilities&#13;and 
loans payable are measured using &amp;#147;Level 2&amp;#148; inputs as there are
no quoted prices in active markets for 
identical&#13;instruments.&amp;#160;&amp;#160;The carrying values of cash, 
accounts payable and accrued liabilities, and loans payable approximate 
their&#13;fair values due to the immediate or short term maturity of these 
financial instruments.&lt;/p&gt;</us-gaap:FairValueOfFinancialInstrumentsPolicy>
    <us-gaap:AssetRetirementObligationsPolicy contextRef="From2015-01-01to2015-
12-31">&lt;p style="font: 8pt/normal Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 
0"&gt;The Company has no asset retirement obligations, 
including&#13;environmental rehabilitation expenditures, which relate to an 
existing condition caused by past operations.&lt;/p&gt;</us-
gaap:AssetRetirementObligationsPolicy>
    <us-gaap:UseOfEstimates contextRef="From2015-01-01to2015-12-31">&lt;p 
style="font: 8pt/normal Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0"&gt;The 
preparation of financial statements, in conformity with&#13;GAAP, requires 
management to make estimates and assumptions that affect the amounts reported in
the financial statements and accompanying&#13;disclosures.&amp;#160;&amp;#160;By
their nature, these estimates are subject to measurement uncertainty and the 
effect on the financial&#13;statements of changes in such estimates in future 
periods could be significant.&amp;#160;&amp;#160;Significant areas requiring 
management&amp;#146;s&#13;estimates and assumptions are determining the fair 
value of transactions involving related parties and common 
stock.&amp;#160;&amp;#160;Actual&#13;results may differ from the 
estimates.&lt;/p&gt;</us-gaap:UseOfEstimates>
    <us-gaap:EarningsPerSharePolicyTextBlock contextRef="From2015-01-01to2015-
12-31">&lt;p style="font: 8pt/normal Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 
0"&gt;The Company reports basic earnings or loss per share in 
accordance&#13;with ASC Topic 260, &amp;#147;Earnings Per 
Share&amp;#148;.&amp;#160;Basic earnings per share is computed by dividing net 
earnings available&#13;to common stockholders by the weighted average number of 
common shares outstanding during the period.&amp;#160;Diluted earnings
per&#13;share is computed similarly, except that the common stock number is 
increased to include the any potential additional common shares,&#13;for example
from the exercise of options or warrants. As the Company generated net losses in
the periods presented, the additional&#13;impact of including potential shares 
from outstanding warrants would be anti-dilutive and is therefore not part of 
the earnings&#13;per share calculation.&lt;/p&gt;</us-
gaap:EarningsPerSharePolicyTextBlock>
    <us-gaap:ShareBasedCompensationOptionAndIncentivePlansPolicy 
contextRef="From2015-01-01to2015-12-31">&lt;p style="font: 8pt/normal Times New 
Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0"&gt;Stock-based compensation is accounted for in 
accordance with&#13;ASC 718 whereby a compensation charge based on the fair 
value of the award is recorded against earnings over the period during&#13;which
the employee is required to perform the services in exchange for the award 
(generally the vesting period). For transactions&#13;with non-employees in which
services are performed in exchange for the Company&amp;#146;s common stock or 
other equity instruments,&#13;the transactions are recorded on the basis of the 
fair value of the service received or the fair value of the equity 
instruments&#13;issued, whichever is more readily measurable at the date of 
issuance. The expense is recognized over the vesting period of 
the&#13;award.&lt;/p&gt;</us-
gaap:ShareBasedCompensationOptionAndIncentivePlansPolicy>
    <LSMG:MineralPropertyInterestAndImpairment contextRef="From2015-01-01to2015-
12-31">&lt;p style="font: 8pt/normal Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 
0"&gt;Mineral property interests are capitalized and recorded at&#13;fair value.
The property interests are periodically assessed for impairment of value when 
facts and circumstances suggest that&#13;the carrying amount of the property 
interest may exceed its recoverable amount. Costs of exploration, evaluation and
retaining&#13;mineral property interests are expensed as incurred. Once the 
Company has identified proven and probable reserves in its investigation&#13;of 
its property interests and upon development of a plan for operating a mine, it 
would enter the development stage and capitalize&#13;future costs until 
production is established. When a property reaches the production stage, the 
related capital costs will be amortized,&#13;using the units-of-production 
method over proven and probable 
reserves.&lt;/p&gt;</LSMG:MineralPropertyInterestAndImpairment>
    <us-gaap:NewAccountingPronouncementsPolicyPolicyTextBlock 
contextRef="From2015-01-01to2015-12-31">&lt;p style="font: 8pt/normal Times New 
Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0"&gt;The Company has implemented all applicable 
new accounting&#13;pronouncements that are in effect. Those pronouncements did 
not have any material impact on the financial statements unless 
otherwise&#13;disclosed, and the Company does not believe that there are any 
other new accounting pronouncements that have been issued that might&#13;have a 
material impact on its financial position or results of 
operations.&lt;/p&gt;</us-gaap:NewAccountingPronouncementsPolicyPolicyTextBlock>

No.&amp;#160;1 on Form&amp;#160;10-K/A to its Annual Report on Form&amp;#160;10-
K for the fiscal year&#13;ended December&amp;#160;31, 2015 which was originally 
filed on March&amp;#160;29, 2016 to correctly include the accrual of mineral 
option&#13;fees, as disclosed in the restated Financial Statements included 
herein. &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; 
background-color: white"&gt;This&#13;Form 10-K/A does not attempt to modify or 
update any other disclosures set forth in the original Annual Report on Form 10-

restated Financial Statements.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;</dei:AmendmentDescription>

    <LSMG:RestatementOfPreviouslyIssuedFinancialStatementsDisclosureTextBlock 
contextRef="From2015-01-01to2015-12-31">&lt;p style="margin: 
0pt"&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt/normal Times New Roman, 
Times, Serif; margin: 0 0 0 0pt; text-align: justify"&gt;Subsequent to the 
original issuance&#13;of the Company&amp;#146;s annual financial statements, the
Company determined that mineral option fees totaling $123,913 owing 
under&#13;the terms of its Mineral Option Agreement with LSG dated October 4, 
2014 had not, but should have been accrued at December 31,&#13;2015. While a 
deferral of the actual payment to June 18, 2016 had been granted by LSG in 
November, 2015, the fees still needed&#13;to be accrued as long as they remained
unpaid. A second deferral was later granted by LSG on June 15, 2016, extending 
the repayment&#13;date to January 18, 2017. On review, the Company determined 
that the amount was material and a restatement was 
required.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt/normal Times New Roman, 
Times, Serif; margin: 0 0 0 27pt; text-align: 
justify"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt/normal Times 
New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0 0 0 0pt; text-align: justify"&gt;No fees were
required to be&#13;accrued at December 31, 2014 in accordance with the terms of 
the agreement.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt/normal Times New Roman,
Times, Serif; margin: 0 0 0 27pt; text-align: 
justify"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt/normal Times 
New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0 0 0 0pt; text-align: justify"&gt;The 
following financial statement&#13;items were affected by the 
restatement:&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt/normal Times New Roman, 
Times, Serif; margin: 0 0 0 27pt; text-align: 
justify"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt/normal Times 
New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0 0 0 0pt; text-align: 
justify"&gt;&lt;b&gt;Balance Sheet&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p 
style="font: 8pt/normal Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0 0 0 27pt; text-
align: justify"&gt;&lt;b&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;table

gaap:ScheduleOfErrorCorrectionsAndPriorPeriodAdjustmentsTextBlock>
    <us-gaap:IncomeTaxPolicyTextBlock contextRef="From2015-01-01to2015-12-
31">&lt;p style="font: 8pt/normal Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0 0 0 
0pt; text-align: justify"&gt;The Company uses the asset and&#13;liability method
of accounting for income taxes in accordance with ASC Topic 740, Income 
Taxes.&amp;#160;&amp;#160;This standard requires&#13;the use of an asset and 
liability approach for financial accounting and reporting on income 
taxes.&amp;#160;&amp;#160;If it is more likely&#13;than not that some portion or
all of a deferred tax asset will not be realized, a valuation allowance is 
recognized.&lt;/p&gt;</us-gaap:IncomeTaxPolicyTextBlock>
    <us-gaap:MineralIndustriesDisclosuresTextBlock contextRef="From2015-01-
01to2015-12-31">&lt;p style="font: 8pt/normal Times New Roman, Times, Serif; 
margin: 0 0 0 0pt; text-align: justify"&gt;On December 5, 2014, the 
Company&#13;entered into a subscription agreement (the &amp;#147;Subscription 
Agreements&amp;#148;) with Lode Star Gold Inc. (&amp;#147;LSG&amp;#148;),&#13;a 
private Nevada corporation controlled by the spouse of the Company&amp;#146;s 
current President,&amp;#160;pursuant to which the Company&#13;agreed to issue 
35,000,000 shares of its common stock, valued at $230,180, to LSG in exchange 
for a 20% undivided interest in and&#13;to the mineral claims owned by LSG. The 
mineral claims, known as the &amp;#147;Goldfield Bonanza Project&amp;#148; (the 
&amp;#147;Property&amp;#148;),&#13;are located in the State of 
Nevada.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt/normal Times New Roman, Times,
Serif; margin: 0 0 0 0pt; text-align: 
justify"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt/normal Times 
New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0 0 0 0pt; text-align: justify"&gt;The 
execution of the Subscription&#13;Agreement was one of the closing conditions of
an Option Agreement dated October 4, 2014, pursuant to which the Company 
acquired&#13;the sole and exclusive option to earn up to an 80% undivided 
interest in and to the Property.&amp;#160;&amp;#160;In order to earn the 
additional&#13;60% interest in the Property, the Company is required to fund all
expenditures on the Property and pay LSG an aggregate of $5 million&#13;in cash 
in the form of a net smelter royalty, each beginning on the Closing Date, which 
was December 11, 2014. Until such time&#13;as the Company has earned the 
additional 60% interest, the net smelter royalty will be split 79.2% to LSG, 
19.8% to the Company&#13;and 1% to the former Property 
owner.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt/normal Times New Roman, Times, 
Serif; margin: 0 0 0 0pt; text-align: 
justify"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt/normal Times 
New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0 0 0 0pt; text-align: justify"&gt;If the 
Company fails to make&#13;any cash payments to LSG within one year of the 
Effective Date of the Mineral Option Agreement with LSG dated October 4, 
2014,&#13;it is required to pay LSG an additional $100,000, and in any 
subsequent years in which the Company fails to complete the payment&#13;of the 
entire $5 million described above, it must make quarterly cash payments to LSG 
of $25,000 until such time as the Company&#13;has earned the additional 60% 
interest in the Property. At December 31, 2015 $123,913 in fees payable to LSG 
has been accrued.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt/normal Times New 
Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0 0 0 0pt; text-align: 
justify"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt/normal Times 
New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0 0 0 0pt; text-align: justify"&gt;Given that 
permitting for operations&#13;on the Property is still to be completed, at the 
request of the Company&amp;#146;s management, LSG granted, by a letter of 
agreement&#13;dated November 10, 2015, a deferment of the payment to June 18, 
2016. A further deferment, to January 18, 2017, was granted by&#13;LSG on June 
15, 2016.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt/normal Times New Roman, 
Times, Serif; margin: 0 0 0 0pt; text-align: 
justify"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt/normal Times 
New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0 0 0 0pt; text-align: justify"&gt;In addition,
the Option Agreement&#13;provides that the Company will act as the operator on 
the Property and that&amp;#160;a management committee will be formed, 
comprised&#13;of representatives from the Company and LSG, with voting based on 
each party&amp;#146;s proportionate interest, to 
supervise&amp;#160;exploration&#13;of the Property and approve work programs and
budgets. To December 31, 2015, no work programs had been 
approved.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt/normal Times New Roman, 
Times, Serif; margin: 0 0 0 0pt; text-align: 
justify"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt/normal Times 
New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0 0 0 0pt; text-align: justify"&gt;The Company 
assessed its mineral&#13;property interest at December 31, 2015 and to the date 
of these financial statements and concluded that facts and circumstances&#13;do 
not suggest that the mineral property interest&amp;#146;s carrying value exceeds
its recoverable amount and therefore no impairment&#13;is 
required.&lt;/p&gt;</us-gaap:MineralIndustriesDisclosuresTextBlock>

<td class="text"><p style="font: 8pt/normal Calibri, Helvetica, Sans-Serif; 
margin: 0; text-align: justify"><font style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, 
Serif; color: #373737; background-color: white">The
Registrant is filing this Amendment No.&#160;1 on Form&#160;10-K/A to its Annual
Report on Form&#160;10-K for the fiscal year
ended December&#160;31, 2015 which was originally filed on March&#160;29, 2016 
to correctly include the accrual of mineral option
fees, as disclosed in the restated Financial Statements included herein. 
</font><font style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; background-color: 
white">This
Form 10-K/A does not attempt to modify or update any other disclosures set forth
in the original Annual Report on Form 10-K, except
as required to reflect the additional information included in the restated 
Financial Statements.</font></p><span></span>
</td>
<td class="text">&#160;<span></span>
</td>
</tr>
<tr class="ro">

Date</a></td>

Definition</a><div><p>State aggregate market value of voting and non-voting

second fiscal quarter. The public float should be reported on the cover page of

cycle, if longer), including liabilities incurred (and for which invoices have 
typically been received) and payable to vendors for goods and services received,
taxes, interest, rent and utilities, accrued salaries and bonuses, payroll taxes
and fringe benefits.</p></div>

<tr><td><div class="body" style="padding: 2px;">
<a href="javascript:void(0);" onclick="top.Show.toggleNext( this );">- 
Definition</a><div><p>Value received from shareholders in common stock-related 
transactions that are in excess of par value or stated value and amounts 
received from other stock-related transactions. Includes only common stock 
transactions (excludes preferred stock transactions). May be called contributed 
capital, capital in excess of par, capital surplus, or paid-in 
capital.</p></div>

<a href="javascript:void(0);" onclick="top.Show.toggleNext( this );">- 
Definition</a><div><p>Sum of the carrying amounts as of the balance sheet date 
of all assets that are expected to be realized in cash, sold, or consumed within
one year (or the normal operating cycle, if longer). Assets are probable future 
economic benefits obtained or controlled by an entity as a result of past 
transactions or events.</p></div>
<a href="javascript:void(0);" onclick="top.Show.toggleNext( this );">+ 
References</a><div style="display: none;"><p>Reference 1: 
http://www.xbrl.org/2003/role/presentationRef<br> -Publisher FASB<br> -Name 
Accounting Standards Codification<br> -Topic 210<br> -SubTopic 10<br> -Section 
S99<br> -Paragraph 1<br> -Subparagraph (SX 210.5-02.9)<br> -URI 
http://asc.fasb.org/extlink&amp;oid=6877327&amp;loc=d3e13212-
122682<br><br>Reference 2: http://www.xbrl.org/2003/role/presentationRef<br> 
-Publisher FASB<br> -Name Accounting Standards Codification<br> -Topic 210<br> 
-SubTopic 10<br> -Section 45<br> -Paragraph 3<br> -URI 
http://asc.fasb.org/extlink&amp;oid=28358313&amp;loc=d3e6801-
107765<br><br>Reference 3: http://www.xbrl.org/2003/role/presentationRef<br> 
-Publisher FASB<br> -Name Accounting Standards Codification<br> -Topic 210<br> 
-SubTopic 10<br> -Section 45<br> -Paragraph 1<br> -URI 
http://asc.fasb.org/extlink&amp;oid=28358313&amp;loc=d3e6676-

<tr><td><div class="body" style="padding: 2px;">
<a href="javascript:void(0);" onclick="top.Show.toggleNext( this );">- 
Definition</a><div><p>Amount of currency on hand as well as demand deposits with
banks or financial institutions. Includes other kinds of accounts that have the 
general characteristics of demand deposits. Excludes cash and cash equivalents 
within disposal group and discontinued operation.</p></div>

<table border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" class="authRefData"
style="display: none;" id="defref_us-gaap_CommitmentsAndContingencies">
<tr><td class="hide"><a style="color: white;" href="javascript:void(0);" 
onclick="top.Show.hideAR();">X</a></td></tr>
<tr><td><div class="body" style="padding: 2px;">
<a href="javascript:void(0);" onclick="top.Show.toggleNext( this );">- 
Definition</a><div><p>Represents the caption on the face of the balance sheet to
indicate that the entity has entered into (1) purchase or supply arrangements 
that will require expending a portion of its resources to meet the terms 
thereof, and (2) is exposed to potential losses or, less frequently, gains, 
arising from (a) possible claims against a company's resources due to future 
performance under contract terms, and (b) possible losses or likely gains from 
uncertainties that will ultimately be resolved when one or more future events 
that are deemed likely to occur do occur or fail to occur.</p></div>
<a href="javascript:void(0);" onclick="top.Show.toggleNext( this );">+

Definition</a><div><p>Aggregate par or stated value of issued nonredeemable 
common stock (or common stock redeemable solely at the option of the issuer). 
This item includes treasury stock repurchased by the entity. Note: elements for 
number of nonredeemable common shares, par value and other disclosure concepts 
are in another section within stockholders' equity.</p></div>

http://asc.fasb.org/extlink&amp;oid=6877327&amp;loc=d3e13212-
122682<br><br>Reference 2: http://www.xbrl.org/2003/role/presentationRef<br> 
-Publisher SEC<br> -Name Regulation S-X (SX)<br> -Number 210<br> -Section 04<br>
-Article 3<br></p></div>
<a href="javascript:void(0);" onclick="top.Show.toggleNext( this );">+ 
Details</a><div style="display: none;"><table border="0" cellpadding="0" 
cellspacing="0">
<tr>
<td><strong> Name:</strong></td>
<td style="white-space:nowrap;">us-gaap_RetainedEarningsAccumulatedDeficit</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td style="padding-right: 4px;white-space:nowrap;"><strong> Namespace 
Prefix:</strong></td>
<td>us-gaap_</td>

<table border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" class="authRefData" 
style="display: none;" id="defref_us-gaap_StockholdersEquity">
<tr><td class="hide"><a style="color: white;" href="javascript:void(0);" 
onclick="top.Show.hideAR();">X</a></td></tr>
<tr><td><div class="body" style="padding: 2px;">
<a href="javascript:void(0);" onclick="top.Show.toggleNext( this );">- 
Definition</a><div><p>Total of all stockholders' equity (deficit) items, net of 
receivables from officers, directors, owners, and affiliates of the entity which
are attributable to the parent. The amount of the economic entity's 
stockholders' equity attributable to the parent excludes the amount of 
stockholders' equity which is allocable to that ownership interest in subsidiary
equity which is not attributable to the parent (noncontrolling interest, 
minority interest). This excludes temporary equity and is sometimes called 
permanent equity.</p></div>
<a href="javascript:void(0);" onclick="top.Show.toggleNext( this );">+ 
References</a><div style="display: none;"><p>Reference 1: 
http://www.xbrl.org/2003/role/presentationRef<br> -Publisher FASB<br> -Name 
Accounting Standards Codification<br> -Topic 310<br> -SubTopic 10<br> -Section 
S99<br> -Paragraph 2<br> -Subparagraph (SAB TOPIC 4.E)<br> -URI 
http://asc.fasb.org/extlink&amp;oid=27010918&amp;loc=d3e74512-
122707<br><br>Reference 2: http://www.xbrl.org/2003/role/presentationRef<br> 
-Publisher FASB<br> -Name Accounting Standards Codification<br> -Topic 210<br> 
-SubTopic 10<br> -Section S99<br> -Paragraph 1<br> -Subparagraph (SX 210.5-
02.29-31)<br> -URI http://asc.fasb.org/extlink&amp;oid=6877327&amp;loc=d3e13212-
122682<br><br>Reference 3: http://www.xbrl.org/2003/role/presentationRef<br> 
-Publisher SEC<br> -Name Staff Accounting Bulletin (SAB)<br> -Number Topic 4<br>
-Section E<br></p></div>

Definition</a><div><p>Total number of common shares of an entity that have been 
sold or granted to shareholders (includes common shares that were issued, 
repurchased and remain in the treasury). These shares represent capital invested
by the firm's shareholders and owners, and may be all or only a portion of the 
number of shares authorized. Shares issued include shares outstanding and shares
held in the treasury.</p></div>

<script type="text/javascript" src="Show.js">/* Do Not Remove This Comment 
*/</script><script type="text/javascript">
function toggleNextSibling (e) {
if
(e.nextSibling.style.display=='none') {
e.nextSibling.style.display='block';
} else
{ e.nextSibling.style.display='none'; }
}</script>
</head>

<table border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" class="authRefData" 
style="display: none;" id="defref_us-gaap_EarningsPerShareBasicAndDiluted">
<tr><td class="hide"><a style="color: white;" href="javascript:void(0);" 
onclick="top.Show.hideAR();">X</a></td></tr>
<tr><td><div class="body" style="padding: 2px;">
<a href="javascript:void(0);" onclick="top.Show.toggleNext( this );">- 
Definition</a><div><p>The amount of net income or loss for the period per each 
share in instances when basic and diluted earnings per share are the same amount
and reported as a single line item on the face of the financial statements.  
Basic earnings per share is the amount of net income or loss for the period per 
each share of common stock or unit outstanding during the reporting period.  
Diluted earnings per share includes the amount of net income or loss for the 
period available to each share of common stock or common unit outstanding during
the reporting period and to each share or unit that would have been outstanding 
assuming the issuance of common shares or units for all dilutive potential 
common shares or units outstanding during the reporting period.</p></div>
<a href="javascript:void(0);" onclick="top.Show.toggleNext( this );">+ 
References</a><div style="display: none;"><p>No definition available.</p></div>
<a href="javascript:void(0);" onclick="top.Show.toggleNext( this );">+ 
Details</a><div style="display: none;"><table border="0" cellpadding="0" 
cellspacing="0">

</tr>
<tr>
<td style="padding-right: 4px;white-space:nowrap;"><strong> Namespace

<td>us-gaap_</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td><strong> Data Type:</strong></td>
<td>num:perShareItemType</td>
</tr>

<td>na</td>
</tr>

<td>duration</td>

<a href="javascript:void(0);" onclick="top.Show.toggleNext( this );">- 
Definition</a><div><p>Difference between the fair value of payments made and the
carrying amount of debt which is extinguished prior to maturity.</p></div>

<tr><td class="hide"><a style="color: white;" href="javascript:void(0);"

<tr><td><div class="body" style="padding: 2px;">
<a href="javascript:void(0);" onclick="top.Show.toggleNext( this );">- 
Definition</a><div><p>The aggregate total of expenses of managing and 
administering the affairs of an entity, including affiliates of the reporting 
entity, which are not directly or indirectly associated with the manufacture, 
sale or creation of a product or product line.</p></div>
<a href="javascript:void(0);" onclick="top.Show.toggleNext( this );">+ 
References</a><div style="display: none;"><p>Reference 1: 
http://www.xbrl.org/2003/role/presentationRef<br> -Publisher FASB<br> -Name

S99<br> -Paragraph 2<br> -Subparagraph (SX 210.5-03.4)<br> -URI

<table border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" class="authRefData"

<tr><td class="hide"><a style="color: white;" href="javascript:void(0);"

<tr><td><div class="body" style="padding: 2px;">
<a href="javascript:void(0);" onclick="top.Show.toggleNext( this );">- 
Definition</a><div><p>The net amount of other income and expense amounts, the 
components of which are not separately disclosed on the income statement, 
resulting from ancillary business-related activities (that is, excluding major 
activities considered part of the normal operations of the business) also known 
as other nonoperating income (expense) recognized for the period. Such amounts 
may include: (a) dividends, (b) interest on securities, (c) net gains or losses 
on securities, (d) unusual costs, (e) gains or losses on foreign exchange 
transactions, and (f) miscellaneous other income and expense items.</p></div>
<a href="javascript:void(0);" onclick="top.Show.toggleNext( this );">+

<table border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" class="authRefData" 
style="display: none;" id="defref_us-gaap_Cash">
<tr><td class="hide"><a style="color: white;" href="javascript:void(0);" 
onclick="top.Show.hideAR();">X</a></td></tr>
<tr><td><div class="body" style="padding: 2px;">
<a href="javascript:void(0);" onclick="top.Show.toggleNext( this );">- 
Definition</a><div><p>Amount of currency on hand as well as demand deposits with
banks or financial institutions. Includes other kinds of accounts that have the 
general characteristics of demand deposits. Excludes cash and cash equivalents 
within disposal group and discontinued operation.</p></div>

References</a><div style="display: none;"><p>Reference 1:

<a href="javascript:void(0);" onclick="top.Show.toggleNext( this );">- 
Definition</a><div><p>Amount of increase (decrease) in cash. Cash is the amount 
of currency on hand as well as demand deposits with banks or financial 
institutions. Includes other kinds of accounts that have the general 
characteristics of demand deposits. Includes effect from exchange rate 
changes.</p></div>

aggregate amount of obligations to be paid to the following types of related 
parties: a parent company and its subsidiaries; subsidiaries of a common parent;
an entity and trust for the benefit of employees, such as pension and profit-
sharing trusts that are managed by or under the trusteeship of the entities' 
management; an entity and its principal owners, management, or member of their 
immediate families; affiliates; or other parties with the ability to exert 
significant influence.</p></div>

Definition</a><div><p>Amount of cash inflow (outflow) from financing activities,
including discontinued operations. Financing activity cash flows include 
obtaining resources from owners and providing them with a return on, and a 
return of, their investment; borrowing money and repaying amounts borrowed, or 
settling the obligation; and obtaining and paying for other resources obtained 
from creditors on long-term credit.</p></div>

<table border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" class="authRefData"

<tr><td class="hide"><a style="color: white;" href="javascript:void(0);"

<tr><td><div class="body" style="padding: 2px;">
<a href="javascript:void(0);" onclick="top.Show.toggleNext( this );">- 
Definition</a><div><p>The portion of profit or loss for the period, net of 
income taxes, which is attributable to the parent.</p></div>

<table border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" class="authRefData" 
style="display: none;" id="defref_us-gaap_StockholdersEquity">
<tr><td class="hide"><a style="color: white;" href="javascript:void(0);" 
onclick="top.Show.hideAR();">X</a></td></tr>
<tr><td><div class="body" style="padding: 2px;">
<a href="javascript:void(0);" onclick="top.Show.toggleNext( this );">- 
Definition</a><div><p>Total of all stockholders' equity (deficit) items, net of 
receivables from officers, directors, owners, and affiliates of the entity which
are attributable to the parent. The amount of the economic entity's 
stockholders' equity attributable to the parent excludes the amount of 
stockholders' equity which is allocable to that ownership interest in subsidiary
equity which is not attributable to the parent (noncontrolling interest, 
minority interest). This excludes temporary equity and is sometimes called 
permanent equity.</p></div>
<a href="javascript:void(0);" onclick="top.Show.toggleNext( this );">+ 
References</a><div style="display: none;"><p>Reference 1: 
http://www.xbrl.org/2003/role/presentationRef<br> -Publisher FASB<br> -Name

S99<br> -Paragraph 2<br> -Subparagraph (SAB TOPIC 4.E)<br> -URI 
http://asc.fasb.org/extlink&amp;oid=27010918&amp;loc=d3e74512-

02.29-31)<br> -URI http://asc.fasb.org/extlink&amp;oid=6877327&amp;loc=d3e13212-

<th class="tl" colspan="1" rowspan="2"><div style="width: 200px;"><strong>1.

<tr class="re">
<td class="pl " style="border-bottom: 0px;" valign="top"><a class="a" 
href="javascript:void(0);" onclick="top.Show.showAR( this, 
'defref_LSMG_NotesToFinancialStatementsAbstract', window );"><strong>Notes to 
Financial Statements</strong></a></td>
<td class="text">&#160;<span></span>
</td>
</tr>
<tr class="ro">
<td class="pl " style="border-bottom: 0px;" valign="top"><a class="a" 
href="javascript:void(0);" onclick="top.Show.showAR( this, 'defref_us-
gaap_BusinessDescriptionAndBasisOfPresentationTextBlock', window );">NOTE 1 - 
BASIS OF PRESENTATION AND NATURE OF OPERATIONS</a></td>
<td class="text"><p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 
0"><font style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, 
Serif"><b>Organization</b></font></p>
<p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0"><font style="font:
8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif">&#160;</font></p>
<p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0"><font style="font:
8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif">Lode-Star
Mining Inc. (formerly International Gold Corp.) (&#147;the Company&#148;) was 
incorporated in the State of Nevada, U.S.A., on
December 9, 2004.&#160;&#160;The Company&#146;s principal executive offices are 
located in Cypress, Texas.&#160;&#160;The Company
was originally formed for the purpose of acquiring exploration stage natural 
resource properties. The Company acquired a mineral
property interest from Lode Star Gold Inc., a private Nevada corporation 
(&#147;LSG&#148;) on December 11, 2014 (See Note 4)
in consideration for the issuance of 35,000,000 common shares of the 
Company.&#160;As a result of this transaction, control of
the Company was acquired by LSG.&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;</font></p>
<p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0"><font style="font:
8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif">&#160;</font></p>
<p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0"><font style="font:
8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif">On
May 12, 2015, International Gold Corp. completed a merger with its wholly owned 
subsidiary, Lode-Star Mining Inc., and formally
assumed the subsidiary&#146;s name by filing Articles of Merger with the Nevada 
Secretary of State (the &#147;Name Change&#148;).&#160;
The subsidiary was incorporated entirely for the purpose of effecting the Name 
Change and the merger did not affect the Company&#146;s
corporate structure in any other way.</font></p>
<p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0"><font style="font:
8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif">&#160;</font></p>
<p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0"><font style="font:
8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif"><b>Going
Concern</b></font></p>
<p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0"><font style="font:
8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif">&#160;</font></p>
<p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0"><font style="font:
8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif">The
accompanying financial statements have been prepared assuming the Company will 
continue as a going concern.</font></p>
<p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0"><font style="font:
8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif">&#160;</font></p>
<p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0"><font style="font:
8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif">The
future of the Company is dependent upon its ability to establish a business and 
to obtain new financing to execute its
business plan. As shown in the accompanying financial statements, the Company 
has had no revenue and has incurred restated
accumulated losses of $1,412,024 for the period from December 9, 2004 
(inception) to December 31 2015.&#160;&#160;There is no
assurance that management&#146;s plans to seek additional capital through 
private placements of its common stock will be
realized, and these factors cast substantial doubt upon the use of the going 
concern assumption. These financial statements
do not include any adjustments relating to the recoverability and classification
of recorded assets, or the amounts of and
classification of liabilities that might be necessary in the event the Company 
cannot continue in existence.</font></p><span></span>
</td>
</tr>
</table>

<tr><td><div class="body" style="padding: 2px;">
<a href="javascript:void(0);" onclick="top.Show.toggleNext( this );">- 
Definition</a><div><p>The entire disclosure for the business description and 
basis of presentation concepts.  Business description describes the nature and 
type of organization including but not limited to organizational structure as 
may be applicable to holding companies, parent and subsidiary relationships, 
business divisions, business units, business segments, affiliates and 
information about significant ownership of the reporting entity.  Basis of 
presentation describes the underlying basis used to prepare the financial 
statements (for example, US Generally Accepted Accounting Principles, Other 
Comprehensive Basis of Accounting, IFRS).</p></div>
<a href="javascript:void(0);" onclick="top.Show.toggleNext( this );">+
